# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/plante-anti-nato-protest-1.7392719): 
Content: "Montreal mayor, police chief defend officers after weekend anti-NATO protest vandalism | CBC News Loaded

[Montreal](/news/canada/montreal)

Montreal mayor, police chief defend officers after weekend anti-NATO protest vandalism
======================================================================================

Montreal Mayor Valérie Plante condemned the actions of protesters and defended police after chaos broke out at a demonstration Friday evening against the NATO Parliamentary Assembly taking place in the city.

'The images from Friday are shocking: people breaking windows, torching vehicles,' said Valérie Plante
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

CBC News · Posted: Nov 25, 2024 3:03 PM EST | Last Updated: November 25, 2024

![A white woman with black hair in a pink blazer speaks into several microphones.](https://i.cbc.ca/1.7392779.1732563545!/fileImage/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/16x9_1180/plante-anti-nato.jpg?im=Resize%3D780)

Monday afternoon, Montreal Mayor Valérie Plante denounced violence at an anti-NATO demonstration that took place Friday evening. (Radio-Canada)

Montreal Mayor Valérie Plante condemned the actions of protesters and defended police after chaos broke out at a demonstration Friday evening against the NATO Parliamentary Assembly taking place in the city.

Plante held a news conference Monday afternoon, saying Montreal police officers have attended nearly 500 protests since the war in Gaza began last fall.

"The images from Friday are shocking: people breaking windows, torching vehicles," Plante said. All three were released and will appear in court at a later date. 

_**WATCH | Smashed windows, torched cars seen at weekend protest:**_ 

![](https://i.cbc.ca/ais/3fb36c4f-03b8-4f31-bd82-adc5481070e6,1732392683285/full/max/0/default.jpg?im=Crop%2Crect%3D%280%2C0%2C1200%2C675%29%3BResize%3D620)

At least 3 arrested after anti-NATO, pro-Palestinian protests in Montreal

9 months ago

Montreal police say at least three people were arrested after anti-NATO and pro-Palestinian demonstrators converged in the city's downtown core, with protesters throwing objects at police, lighting two vehicles on fire and breaking windows.

The protest, organized by the Divest for Palestine collective and anti-capitalist group CLAC, was meant to denounce the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, as the city hosts the 70th annual session of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly from Nov. 22 to 25.

Organizers said the purpose of the protest was to demonstrate against what he called NATO's "complicity with Israel's military while it's conducting its genocide in Gaza." They also pointed to "war crimes in Lebanon, Syria" and other injustices in the region.

While Canada and the United States are NATO members, Israel is not.

*   [Trudeau, political leaders denounce 'violence and hatred' at anti-NATO demonstration in Montreal](/news/canada/montreal/anti-nato-protest-montreal-1.7391642)
    

Plante blamed the property damage on what she called "professional vandals" who she said are known to police. She accused them of co-opting the protests to carry out violence and said more arrests are expected once police examine more footage from the events.

No place for hate at protests: Trudeau
--------------------------------------

Prime Minister Justin Trudeau also addressed the protests on Monday. 

"In democracy, we will always defend freedom of expression, of protesting, of expressing our opposition on certain positions, but there is never place for violence, for hate or intimidation," Trudeau told reporters. 

On Saturday, on X, Trudeau called what happened "appalling."

"Acts of antisemitism, intimidation and violence must be condemned wherever we see them," he wrote.

He said the RCMP was in touch with local police, adding "there must be consequences and rioters held accountable."

_**WATCH | Trudeau comments on Friday's protest:**_ 

![](https://i.cbc.ca/ais/07f1ea35-9a26-4dea-a926-7d6d2d1b50b8,1732548679000/full/max/0/default.jpg?im=Crop%2Crect%3D%280%2C0%2C1920%2C1080%29%3BResize%3D620)

Montreal rioters should be pursued to full extent of the law, Trudeau says

9 months ago

Prime Minister Justin Trudeau opened his remarks at the NATO Parliamentary Assembly in Montreal, the location of violent anti-NATO protests over the weekend, by saying while people have the right to demonstrate there should never be any violence, and he expects 'those responsible to be pursued and punished under the full extent of the law.'

Over the weekend, Montreal police said they have not received any reports of antisemitic acts or other hate crimes related to the demonstration.

Plante was asked Monday whether Friday's protests were antisemitic, but she said she did not believe they were. 

The mayor noted that the _Service de police de la Ville de Montréal_ (SPVM) is the only police service in the province to have received special training on crowd management, terrorist attacks and cybersecurity. 

"I'm extremely proud of the police force we have here in Montreal. The work will continue," Plante said.

In an interview with [Radio-Canada's morning radio program](https://ici.radio-canada.ca/ohdio/premiere/emissions/1124/tout-un-matin)
 _[Tout un matin](https://ici.radio-canada.ca/ohdio/premiere/emissions/1124/tout-un-matin)
,_ Dagher said the chaos only lasted about five minutes. 

"It's as if we played a spotless hockey season but all that's talked about is the one goal that went through," Dagher said, after noting the hundreds of demonstrations Montreal police have watched over in the past year.

Written by Verity Stevenson

Content: "John Mahoney Montreal Gazette

Mayor Valérie Plante has slammed the “unacceptable” vandalism that occurred during a pro-Palestinian protest in Montreal on Sunday in which demonstrators smashed windows at Concordia University and luxury stores and launched Molotov cocktails at police.

The demonstration, which began around 9:15 p.m., involved some 60 protesters, according to police spokesperson Jean-Pierre Brabant. [https://t.co/bFPfWeNOaP](https://t.co/bFPfWeNOaP)
> 
> — Valérie Plante (@Val\_Plante) [September 30, 2024](https://twitter.com/Val_Plante/status/1840820018743034064?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

The protest follows an incident last week in which three individuals were detained after clashes between police and protesters near the Guy-Concordia métro station.

On Monday, Graham Carr, Concordia University’s president, wrote to the campus community, stating that the university is still evaluating the situation but that he is “extremely concerned about the violent escalation of recent protests.”

“Behaviour that contributes to a climate of intimidation cannot be tolerated, and the university will seek to sanction members of the community who engage in such activities,” he added.

A spokesperson for the university confirmed there were no injuries and that an investigation is ongoing.

After the vandalism unfolded Sunday night, images circulated on social media, with the Instagram account Clash MTL appearing to endorse the protest, sharing photos of the destruction.

      

Broken windows are seen at Concordia University’s Hall Building in Montreal on Monday, Sept. Authorities are reviewing security footage to identify those responsible for the vandalism and throwing the incendiary devices.

“The SPVM made the arrests. The conflict has now spilled into Lebanon, between Israel and Hezbollah.

As the anniversary of the Hamas attack nears next week, pro-Palestinian groups are reportedly planning a “week of rage,” organizing further demonstrations against Israel’s ongoing military operations.

Brabant said police would be present at upcoming protests, as usual, to ensure public safety and that they would intervene in cases of criminal activity.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:13> This image shows a traffic sign in Montreal in July 2024 which displays a 'Free Palestine. Escalate now' message and was authorized by Montreal's Mayor Valérie Plante."

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:13>)
web_search("Free Palestine Montreal sign")
web_search("Valérie Plante Free Palestine")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Palestine': 0.85, 'Canada': 0.07, 'Germany': 0.02, 'Austria': 0.01, 'Israel': 0.01, 'Poland': 0.01, 'Slovenia': 0.01, 'South Korea': 0.01, 'Albania': 0.0, 'Andorra': 0.0}

### Evidence from `web_search`
In July 2024, electronic traffic signs in Montreal displayed pro-Palestinian slogans, including "Free Palestine" and "Escalate now" (<image:13>). These signs were altered at construction sites, and the original messages were restored. The City of Montreal called the incident an act of vandalism.

The City of Montreal has a history of removing pro-Palestine signs. Jeremy Levi, the mayor of Hampstead, called on Montreal Mayor Valérie Plante to take a stand against the signs.
The Jerusalem Post reported on electronic street signs in Montreal displaying "Globalize the intifada".
Sources: [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/montreal-traffic-signs-pro-palestinian-slogans-1.7274809](https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/montreal-traffic-signs-pro-palestinian-slogans-1.7274809), [https://www.readthemaple.com/city-of-montreal-illegally-seized-pro-palestine-signs-activists-allege/](https://www.readthemaple.com/city-of-montreal-illegally-seized-pro-palestine-signs-activists-allege/), [https://www.jpost.com/diaspora/antisemitism/article-812229](https://www.jpost.com/diaspora/antisemitism/article-812229).

# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image shows a traffic sign in Montreal displaying "Free Palestine. Escalate now." in July 2024. The evidence confirms that similar signs appeared in Montreal during that time, but the city considered them vandalism. The evidence does not indicate that the sign was authorized by Montreal's Mayor Valérie Plante. In fact, the mayor condemned the actions related to the signs.

Therefore, the claim is partially accurate. The image is of a sign in Montreal in July 2024. However, the claim that the sign was authorized by Montreal's Mayor Valérie Plante is false.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:13> This image shows a traffic sign in Montreal in July 2024 which displays a 'Free Palestine. Escalate now' message and was authorized by Montreal's Mayor Valérie Plante."

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:13>)
web_search("Free Palestine Montreal sign")
web_search("Valérie Plante Free Palestine")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Palestine': 0.85, 'Canada': 0.07, 'Germany': 0.02, 'Austria': 0.01, 'Israel': 0.01, 'Poland': 0.01, 'Slovenia': 0.01, 'South Korea': 0.01, 'Albania': 0.0, 'Andorra': 0.0}

### Evidence from `web_search`
In July 2024, electronic traffic signs in Montreal displayed pro-Palestinian slogans, including "Free Palestine" and "Escalate now" (<image:13>). These signs were altered at construction sites, and the original messages were restored. The City of Montreal called the incident an act of vandalism.

The City of Montreal has a history of removing pro-Palestine signs. Jeremy Levi, the mayor of Hampstead, called on Montreal Mayor Valérie Plante to take a stand against the signs.
The Jerusalem Post reported on electronic street signs in Montreal displaying "Globalize the intifada".
Sources: [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/montreal-traffic-signs-pro-palestinian-slogans-1.7274809](https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/montreal-traffic-signs-pro-palestinian-slogans-1.7274809), [https://www.readthemaple.com/city-of-montreal-illegally-seized-pro-palestine-signs-activists-allege/](https://www.readthemaple.com/city-of-montreal-illegally-seized-pro-palestine-signs-activists-allege/), [https://www.jpost.com/diaspora/antisemitism/article-812229](https://www.jpost.com/diaspora/antisemitism/article-812229).


### Evidence from `web_search`
The Suburban published an article stating that Mayor Valérie Plante was served by bailiff regarding pro-Palestinian electronic signs used in construction areas, which displayed messages such as "Free Palestine. Valérie Plante needs to take concrete action." The police are investigating the incident, which was claimed by a group called Clash MTL. <image:8320> shows a sign that says "INTIFADA NOW". The Montreal Gazette reports on a pro-Palestinian protest in Montreal on September 30, 2024, where demonstrators vandalized Concordia University and luxury stores. Montreal Mayor Valérie Plante condemned the vandalism. <image:13>

A CBC News article discusses an anti-NATO protest in Montreal where protesters demonstrated against the NATO Parliamentary Assembly. Montreal Mayor Valérie Plante condemned the actions of protesters. The protest was organized by the Divest for Palestine collective and anti-capitalist group CLAC. <image:1>


## Elaboration
The image shows a traffic sign in Montreal displaying "Free Palestine. Escalate now." in July 2024. The evidence confirms that similar signs appeared in Montreal during that time, but the city considered them vandalism. The evidence does not indicate that the sign was authorized by Montreal's Mayor Valérie Plante. In fact, the mayor condemned the actions related to the signs.

Therefore, the claim is partially accurate. The image is of a sign in Montreal in July 2024. However, the claim that the sign was authorized by Montreal's Mayor Valérie Plante is false.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image depicts a traffic sign in Montreal displaying a "Free Palestine" message in July 2024. While the evidence confirms the presence of such signs, it also indicates that the city considered them vandalism and that the mayor did not authorize them.

`false`

* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

In July 2024, electronic traffic signs in Montreal displayed pro-Palestinian slogans, including "Free Palestine" and "Escalate now" (<image:13>). These signs were altered at construction sites, and the original messages were restored. The City of Montreal called the incident an act of vandalism.

Valérie Plante needs to take concrete action." The police are investigating the incident, which was claimed by a group called Clash MTL. <image:8320> shows a sign that says "INTIFADA NOW". Montreal Mayor Valérie Plante condemned the vandalism. <image:13>

The evidence does not indicate that the sign was authorized by Montreal's Mayor Valérie Plante. In fact, the mayor condemned the actions related to the signs.

## Final Judgement
The image depicts a traffic sign in Montreal displaying a "Free Palestine" message in July 2024. While the evidence confirms the presence of such signs, it also indicates that the city considered them vandalism and that the mayor did not authorize them.

`false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image depicts a traffic sign in Montreal displaying "Free Palestine" in July 2024, which is supported by evidence from multiple sources, including a CBC News article ([https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/montreal-traffic-signs-pro-palestinian-slogans-1.7274809](https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/montreal-traffic-signs-pro-palestinian-slogans-1.7274809)). However, the claim that the sign was authorized by Montreal's Mayor Valérie Plante is false, as the city considered the signs vandalism and the mayor condemned the actions.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: image_search()

## Claim

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/29/politics/gaza-condoms-fact-check): 
Content: "Five big reasons to be skeptical Trump’s story is true
===================================================================================================

 [![Daniel Dale](https://media.cnn.com/api/v1/images/stellar/prod/200310163716-daniel-dale-background.jpg?c=16x9&q=h_270,w_480,c_fill/c_thumb,g_face,w_100,h_100)](https://www.cnn.com/profiles/daniel-dale)

Women's health [See your latest updates](/follow?iid=follow_see_all_article&source=acq_web_experiments_follow_card-social-bar-all)

![White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt holds her first news conference in the Brady Press Briefing Room at the White House on January 28, 2025 in Washington, DC.](https://media.cnn.com/api/v1/images/stellar/prod/c-gettyimages-2196429905.jpg?c=16x9&q=h_833,w_1480,c_fill)

White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt holds her first news conference in the Brady Press Briefing Room at the White House on Tuesday in Washington, DC.

Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images

Washington CNN  — 

During her [first official White House briefing](https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/28/media/karoline-leavitt-first-press-conference/index.html)
 as President Donald Trump’s press secretary, Karoline Leavitt announced that Trump had prevented a “preposterous waste of taxpayer money.” Trump’s team, [she said](https://rollcall.com/factbase/trump/transcript/donald-trump-press-conference-briefing-karoline-leavitt-january-28-2025/)
, used the president’s [pause on foreign aid](https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/28/politics/trump-foreign-aid-cuts-impact/index.html)
 to thwart a plan in which “there was about to be $50 million taxpayer dollars that went out the door to fund condoms in Gaza.”

Leavitt’s Tuesday comments made headlines around the world. And when CNN asked Leavitt and her colleagues for any evidence, another White House official instead pointed us to comments from the State Department — comments that, as we’ll discuss below, did not even repeat Leavitt’s claim of a planned $50 million Gaza condom expenditure, let alone prove the claim.

**In three previous years under Biden, USAID spent _no_ money on condoms in the entire Middle East**: A detailed [federal report published last year](https://www.usaid.gov/sites/default/files/2024-09/C-and-C-FY2023.pdf)
 said USAID did not provide or fund _any_ condoms in the Middle East in the 2021, 2022 and 2023 fiscal years.

The report, [noted](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/jan/28/donald-trump-executive-orders-transgender-troops-dei-covid-us-politics-live?page=with:block-679977268f086189f840e07b#block-679977268f086189f840e07b)
 by The Guardian on Tuesday, said the only Middle East contraceptives provided or funded by USAID during that three-year period went to the country of Jordan in fiscal 2023. Prevented $102 million in unjustified funding to a contractor in Gaza, including money for contraception.” She did not specify how much of the $102 million in funding was intended for contraception, let alone for condoms in particular.

In an email to reporters earlier Tuesday, Bruce said the entity that was supposed to get $102 million is the International Medical Corps – a US-based organization that [operates two field hospitals in Gaza](https://internationalmedicalcorps.org/country/gaza/)
.

In a statement to CNN on Wednesday, International Medical Corps said that it has received about $68 million from the US Agency for International Development for Gaza operations since October 7, 2023, the day of Hamas’ major attack on Israel. And the president himself told an even more dramatic version of the story in a speech on Wednesday, saying that “we identified and stopped $50 million being sent to Gaza to buy condoms for Hamas.”

But there are at least five big reasons to be skeptical that the story is true.

**The White House offered no evidence for the story**: Leavitt provided no proof for her claim that there was ever a federal plan to spend $50 million on condoms in Gaza. This was “a small order of injectables and progestin-only contraceptive pills” totaling about $46,000.

**Total worldwide USAID condom spending is far less than $50 million**: In the 2023 fiscal year, USAID provided or funded a global total of about $7.1 million worth of male condoms and about $1.1 million worth of female condoms, overwhelmingly to countries in Africa, according to the federal report.

In other words, Leavitt was essentially claiming Tuesday that the Biden administration had decided to provide more than six times the 2023 worldwide value of condoms to a single tiny territory that has [about 2.1 million people](https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/01/middleeast/israel-population-migration-war-intl/index.html)
 and that is in a region that usually does not receive condoms from the US.

A former senior Biden official who worked on Gaza aid issues told CNN that Leavitt’s story about a $50 million condom expenditure for Gaza was “imaginary.” The former official said: “It’s a lie, they are making s\*\*\* up.”

**The State Department would not repeat Leavitt’s claim**: The White House official pointed to a series of social media posts from State Department spokesperson Tammy Bruce, who listed specific examples of how Trump’s aid pause had prevented what Bruce called unjustified spending that wouldn’t make the country “safer, stronger, and more prosperous.”

But Bruce did not mention $50 million for condoms in Gaza.

Instead, Bruce was vague about how much condom spending was supposedly stopped. While International Medical Corps has [publicly discussed](https://internationalmedicalcorps.org/story/youre-pregnant-in-gaza-what-happens-next/)
 its reproductive and sexual health services in Gaza, among various other services from cardiology to orthopedics, the organization said in the Wednesday statement that “no US government funding was used to procure or distribute condoms.”

The organization said the US funding has paid for the two hospitals’ “lifesaving medical care” for roughly 33,000 civilians per month. Like Bruce’s Tuesday social media posts and email to reporters, this Wednesday statement did not repeat Leavitt’s claim that there was $50 million in planned funding for condoms in particular; it provided no dollar figure at all for condoms.

**Experts expressed doubt about Leavitt’s story — or simply called it wrong**: Experts on US aid to Gaza and global health aid were baffled by the claim that the US had been planning to spend $50 million on condoms in Gaza.

“We have asked around, and no one is sure what this is referring to,” said Steve Fake, a spokesperson for Anera, an aid nonprofit that has partnered with USAID on a [five-year, $50 million health initiative in Gaza](https://www.anera.org/press/usaid-partners-with-anera-to-launch-gaza-health-recovery-activity-to-improve-health-services-in-gaza/)
.

Fake said this Anera program has “definitely no purchase of condoms” and added: “Our whole program is $50 (million) and represents a significant portion of total US aid going to Gaza.”

[Matthew Kavanagh](https://oneill.law.georgetown.edu/experts/matthew-m-kavanagh/)
, director of Georgetown University’s Center for Global Health Policy and Politics, said that after doing some digging into Leavitt’s claim, “It seems clear to me there was no $50 million in condoms going to Gaza. [](#maincontent)

Fact check: $50 million for condoms in Gaza? [She wrote](https://x.com/statedeptspox/status/1884404233052831790)
: “Example 1: Condoms. Trump’s freeze, the organization said, halts US funding for hospital services like performing about 30 lifesaving surgeries per day, delivering about 20 babies per day, running an emergency room receiving up to 200 patients per day, and operating one of Gaza’s only neonatal intensive care units and only stabilization centers for severely malnourished children.

“If the stop-work order remains in place, we will be unable to sustain these activities beyond the next week or so,” the organization said.

A State Department official issued an additional statement to CNN on Wednesday that asserted that the funding Trump had stopped from going to the International Medical Corps “included” funds for family planning, emergency contraceptives and prevention of sexually transmitted infections."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
CNN published an article on January 29, 2025, fact-checking the claim that $50 million in US taxpayer money was going to fund condoms in Gaza. The article states that the White House offered no evidence for the story. The article also mentions that USAID spent no money on condoms in the Middle East in the 2021, 2022, and 2023 fiscal years. <image:k>

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/americas/musk-walks-back-claim-us-intended-to-send-50m-worth-of-condoms-to-gaza/3479148): 
Content: "But why are we doing that?" he said.

His comments followed claims by US President Donald Trump, who earlier this month alleged that his administration had “identified and stopped $50 million being sent to Gaza to buy condoms for Hamas.”

The claim was first announced by White House spokesperson Karoline Leavitt in her first press briefing, saying the Musk-led Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) and the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) had found “that there was about to be 50 million taxpayer dollars that went out the door to fund condoms in Gaza.” However, the administration provided no evidence to support the assertion.

A review of publicly available USAID data from 2007 to 2023 contradicts the claim, showing no record of condom shipments to Gaza. [World](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/world)
, [Americas](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/americas)
, [Middle East](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/middle-east)
  
  

Musk walks back claim US intended to send $50M worth of condoms to Gaza
=======================================================================

#### 'Some of the things that I say will be incorrect and should be corrected,' US billionaire says

Rabia Iclal Turan  | 12.02.2025 - Update : 12.02.2025

![Musk walks back claim US intended to send $50M worth of condoms to Gaza](https://cdnuploads.aa.com.tr/uploads/Contents/2025/02/12/thumbs_b_c_c16047d6d58b98e03a5679813527f929.jpg?v=074424)  
  

[![](https://cdnassets.aa.com.tr/assets/newVersion/images/next-sosyal-icon.png)](https://sosyal.teknofest.app/share?url=http://v.aa.com.tr/3479148&text=Musk+walks+back+claim+US+intended+to+send+%2450M+worth+of+condoms+to+Gaza)
[](http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http://v.aa.com.tr/3479148&p[images][0]=https://cdnuploads.aa.com.tr/uploads/Contents/2025/02/12/thumbs_b_c_c16047d6d58b98e03a5679813527f929.jpg?v=074424&p[title]=Musk walks back claim US intended to send $50M worth of condoms to Gaza&p[summary]='Some of the things that I say will be incorrect and should be corrected,' US billionaire says)
[](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://v.aa.com.tr/3479148&text=Musk+walks+back+claim+US+intended+to+send+%2450M+worth+of+condoms+to+Gaza)
[](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=http://v.aa.com.tr/3479148&title=Musk+walks+back+claim+US+intended+to+send+%2450M+worth+of+condoms+to+Gaza)
[](mailto:?subject=Musk+walks+back+claim+US+intended+to+send+%2450M+worth+of+condoms+to+Gaza&body=Musk+walks+back+claim+US+intended+to+send+%2450M+worth+of+condoms+to+Gaza http://v.aa.com.tr/3479148)
[](#!)

**WASHINGTON**

Billionaire Elon Musk backtracked Tuesday on his claim that the US had been intending to send $50 million worth of condoms to the Gaza Strip.

“First of all, some of the things that I say will be incorrect and should be corrected,” Musk told reporters in the Oval Office when asked about fact-checking reports that million of dollars were actually earmarked towards the prevention of sexually transmitted diseases in Gaza province of Mozambique.

“We will make mistakes, but we’ll act quickly to correct any mistakes," he said.

"I’m not sure we should be sending $50 million worth of condoms to anywhere. And that is really an enormous number of condoms," Musk continued.

"If it went to Mozambique instead of Gaza…okay, that's not as bad. **Please contact us for subscription options.**](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/p/subscription/1001)

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
Anadolu Agency reports that Elon Musk backtracked on his claim that the US intended to send $50 million worth of condoms to Gaza. The article mentions that the claim was initially made by a White House spokesperson. The article also states that a review of USAID data from 2007 to 2023 showed no record of condom shipments to Gaza. The article was published on 12.02.2025. <image:1>

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "$50 Million in US taxpayer money almost went to fund condoms in Gaza before DOGE cut it."

## Actions
```
web_search("US taxpayer money condoms Gaza DOGE")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2025/01/29/gaza-condoms-fact-checker-trump/): 
Content: "Democracy Dies in Darkness

Analysis by [Glenn Kessler](https://www.washingtonpost.com/people/glenn-kessler/)

_“DOGE and OMB also found that there was about to be 50 million taxpayer dollars that went out the door to fund condoms in Gaza. That is a preposterous waste of taxpayer money. So, that’s what this pause is focused on, being good stewards of tax dollars.”_

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "$50 Million in US taxpayer money almost went to fund condoms in Gaza before DOGE cut it."

## Actions
```
web_search("US taxpayer money condoms Gaza DOGE")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/29/politics/gaza-condoms-fact-check): 
Content: CNN published an article on January 29, 2025, fact-checking the claim that $50 million in US taxpayer money was going to fund condoms in Gaza. The article states that the White House offered no evidence for the story. The article also mentions that USAID spent no money on condoms in the Middle East in the 2021, 2022, and 2023 fiscal years. <image:k>


From [Source](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/americas/musk-walks-back-claim-us-intended-to-send-50m-worth-of-condoms-to-gaza/3479148): 
Content: Anadolu Agency reports that Elon Musk backtracked on his claim that the US intended to send $50 million worth of condoms to Gaza. The article mentions that the claim was initially made by a White House spokesperson. The article also states that a review of USAID data from 2007 to 2023 showed no record of condom shipments to Gaza. The article was published on 12.02.2025. <image:1>


From [Source](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2025/01/29/gaza-condoms-fact-checker-trump/): 
Content: The Washington Post published an analysis by Glenn Kessler. According to the analysis, DOGE and OMB found that $50 million in taxpayer money was going to fund condoms in Gaza. <image:1>


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
CNN ([Source](https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/29/politics/gaza-condoms-fact-check)) fact-checked the claim that $50 million in US taxpayer money was going to fund condoms in Gaza, stating that the White House offered no evidence. USAID spent no money on condoms in the Middle East in the 2021, 2022, and 2023 fiscal years.

Anadolu Agency ([Source](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/americas/musk-walks-back-claim-us-intended-to-send-50m-worth-of-condoms-to-gaza/3479148)) reports that Elon Musk backtracked on the claim, and a review of USAID data from 2007 to 2023 showed no record of condom shipments to Gaza. The Washington Post ([Source](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2025/01/29/gaza-condoms-fact-checker-trump/)) published an analysis stating that DOGE and OMB found that $50 million in taxpayer money was going to fund condoms in Gaza. <image:k> <image:1>

_________________________



DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "$50 Million in US taxpayer money almost went to fund condoms in Gaza before DOGE cut it."

## Actions
```
web_search("US taxpayer money condoms Gaza DOGE")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
CNN ([Source](https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/29/politics/gaza-condoms-fact-check)) fact-checked the claim that $50 million in US taxpayer money was going to fund condoms in Gaza, stating that the White House offered no evidence. USAID spent no money on condoms in the Middle East in the 2021, 2022, and 2023 fiscal years.

Anadolu Agency ([Source](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/americas/musk-walks-back-claim-us-intended-to-send-50m-worth-of-condoms-to-gaza/3479148)) reports that Elon Musk backtracked on the claim, and a review of USAID data from 2007 to 2023 showed no record of condom shipments to Gaza. The Washington Post ([Source](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2025/01/29/gaza-condoms-fact-checker-trump/)) published an analysis stating that DOGE and OMB found that $50 million in taxpayer money was going to fund condoms in Gaza. <image:k> <image:1>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is not supported by the evidence. CNN ([Source](https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/29/politics/gaza-condoms-fact-check)) fact-checked the claim and found no evidence to support it. Furthermore, USAID did not spend any money on condoms in the Middle East in the fiscal years 2021, 2022, and 2023. Elon Musk also backtracked on the claim.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "$50 Million in US taxpayer money almost went to fund condoms in Gaza before DOGE cut it."

## Actions
```
web_search("US taxpayer money condoms Gaza DOGE")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
CNN ([Source](https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/29/politics/gaza-condoms-fact-check)) fact-checked the claim that $50 million in US taxpayer money was going to fund condoms in Gaza, stating that the White House offered no evidence. USAID spent no money on condoms in the Middle East in the 2021, 2022, and 2023 fiscal years.

Anadolu Agency ([Source](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/americas/musk-walks-back-claim-us-intended-to-send-50m-worth-of-condoms-to-gaza/3479148)) reports that Elon Musk backtracked on the claim, and a review of USAID data from 2007 to 2023 showed no record of condom shipments to Gaza. The Washington Post ([Source](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2025/01/29/gaza-condoms-fact-checker-trump/)) published an analysis stating that DOGE and OMB found that $50 million in taxpayer money was going to fund condoms in Gaza. <image:k> <image:1>


## Elaboration
The claim is not supported by the evidence. CNN ([Source](https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/29/politics/gaza-condoms-fact-check)) fact-checked the claim and found no evidence to support it. Furthermore, USAID did not spend any money on condoms in the Middle East in the fiscal years 2021, 2022, and 2023. Elon Musk also backtracked on the claim.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence indicates that the claim is false. Multiple sources, including CNN and the Anadolu Agency, have fact-checked the claim and found no evidence to support it. Additionally, USAID data from 2007 to 2023 shows no record of condom shipments to Gaza.

`false`
_________________________



SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "$50 Million in US taxpayer money almost went to fund condoms in Gaza before DOGE cut it."

## Actions
```
web_search("US taxpayer money condoms Gaza DOGE")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
CNN ([Source](https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/29/politics/gaza-condoms-fact-check)) fact-checked the claim that $50 million in US taxpayer money was going to fund condoms in Gaza, stating that the White House offered no evidence. USAID spent no money on condoms in the Middle East in the 2021, 2022, and 2023 fiscal years.

Anadolu Agency ([Source](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/americas/musk-walks-back-claim-us-intended-to-send-50m-worth-of-condoms-to-gaza/3479148)) reports that Elon Musk backtracked on the claim, and a review of USAID data from 2007 to 2023 showed no record of condom shipments to Gaza. The Washington Post ([Source](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2025/01/29/gaza-condoms-fact-checker-trump/)) published an analysis stating that DOGE and OMB found that $50 million in taxpayer money was going to fund condoms in Gaza. <image:k> <image:1>


## Elaboration
The claim is not supported by the evidence. CNN ([Source](https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/29/politics/gaza-condoms-fact-check)) fact-checked the claim and found no evidence to support it. Furthermore, USAID did not spend any money on condoms in the Middle East in the fiscal years 2021, 2022, and 2023. Elon Musk also backtracked on the claim.


## Final Judgement
The evidence indicates that the claim is false. Multiple sources, including CNN and the Anadolu Agency, have fact-checked the claim and found no evidence to support it. Additionally, USAID data from 2007 to 2023 shows no record of condom shipments to Gaza.

`false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is false. Fact-checks by CNN ([Source](https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/29/politics/gaza-condoms-fact-check)) and other sources found no evidence to support the claim that US taxpayer money was going to fund condoms in Gaza. USAID did not spend money on condoms in the Middle East in recent fiscal years, and Elon Musk retracted the claim.

_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:17> This is an authentic image of Mike Tyson posing with the Palestinian flag in the ring before his fight against Jake Paul on November, 15, 2024."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
web_search("Mike Tyson Jake Paul fight date")
web_search("Mike Tyson Palestinian flag")
image_search("Mike Tyson Palestinian flag fight")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:17> This is an authentic image of Mike Tyson posing with the Palestinian flag in the ring before his fight against Jake Paul on November, 15, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Mike Tyson Jake Paul fight date")
web_search("Mike Tyson Palestinian flag")
image_search("Mike Tyson Palestinian flag fight")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson):

| --- | --- | --- |
| Boxer | [Jake Paul](/wiki/Jake_Paul "Jake Paul") | [Mike Tyson](/wiki/Mike_Tyson "Mike Tyson") |

| Hometown | [Cleveland, Ohio](/wiki/Cleveland,_Ohio "Cleveland, Ohio")<br>, U.S. ["Mike Tyson vs Paul Young fight in July canceled, new date to be set"](https://www.fightmag.com/mike-tyson-vs-jake-paul-fight-in-july-canceled-new-date-to-be-set/)
    . Jake Paul results, highlights: Round-by-round analysis for Netflix fight"](https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/boxing/2024/11/15/mike-tyson-jake-paul-live-updates-highlights/76266132007/)
    . The bout took place on November 15, 2024, at the [AT&T Stadium](/wiki/AT%26T_Stadium "AT&T Stadium")
 in [Arlington, Texas](/wiki/Arlington,_Texas "Arlington, Texas")
, and was streamed globally on [Netflix](/wiki/Netflix "Netflix")
, with 65 million concurrent viewers[\[4\]](#cite_note-Variety-4)
[\[5\]](#cite_note-Bloomberg-5)
 making it the most-streamed sporting event ever at the time.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)
 Paul defeated Tyson via [unanimous decision](/wiki/Unanimous_decision "Unanimous decision")
.[\[3\]](#cite_note-CNN-3)

Originally, the bout was scheduled to take place on July 20 but was postponed due to Tyson suffering an ulcer flare-up aboard a plane.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

Background
----------

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson&action=edit&section=1 "Edit section: Background")\
\]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Jake_Paul_%2853116882732%29_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Jake_Paul_%2853116882732%29_%28cropped%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Jake_Paul_(53116882732)_(cropped).jpg)

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Mike_Tyson_Photo_Op_GalaxyCon_Austin_2023.jpg/250px-Mike_Tyson_Photo_Op_GalaxyCon_Austin_2023.jpg)](/wiki/File:Mike_Tyson_Photo_Op_GalaxyCon_Austin_2023.jpg)

[Jake Paul](/wiki/Jake_Paul "Jake Paul")
 (left) and [Mike Tyson](/wiki/Mike_Tyson "Mike Tyson")
 (right)

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/%D7%98%D7%99%D7%99%D7%A1%D7%95%D7%9F_%D7%95%D7%A4%D7%95%D7%9C.jpg/250px-%D7%98%D7%99%D7%99%D7%A1%D7%95%D7%9F_%D7%95%D7%A4%D7%95%D7%9C.jpg)](/wiki/File:%D7%98%D7%99%D7%99%D7%A1%D7%95%D7%9F_%D7%95%D7%A4%D7%95%D7%9C.jpg)

[Broadway](/wiki/Broadway_(Manhattan) "Broadway (Manhattan)")
, [New York](/wiki/New_York_City "New York City")
, November 2024

On November 3, 2023, it was reported that Netflix was considering streaming a [boxing match](/wiki/Boxing_match "Boxing match")
 involving Jake Paul on their service.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

On March 7, 2024, [Netflix](/wiki/Netflix "Netflix")
 and [Most Valuable Promotions](/wiki/Most_Valuable_Promotions "Most Valuable Promotions")
 announced that they were partnering to host an event headlined by Paul facing former undisputed heavyweight world champion Mike Tyson on July 20 at the [AT&T Stadium](/wiki/AT%26T_Stadium "AT&T Stadium")
 in [Arlington, Texas](/wiki/Arlington,_Texas "Arlington, Texas")
.[\[4\]](#cite_note-Variety-4)
 On April 2, Tyson confirmed at the time the bout was sanctioned as an [exhibition bout](/wiki/Exhibition_bout "Exhibition bout")
.[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)
 On April 10, Paul confirmed that they would be submitting a request to the Texas Combative Sports Program for the bout to be sanctioned as a [professional bout](/wiki/Professional_boxing "Professional boxing")
.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)
 On April 29, the [Texas Department of Licensing and Regulations](/wiki/Texas_Department_of_Licensing_and_Regulation "Texas Department of Licensing and Regulation")
 confirmed it approved the fighters' request and that the bout would be a sanctioned, professional fight.[\[11\]](#cite_note-Fox_Sports-11)

On May 31, Netflix announced that the event had been postponed due to Tyson suffering a [ulcer flare up](/wiki/Ulcer "Ulcer")
 while boarding a plane.[\[12\]](#cite_note-12)
 Paul took to X (formerly known as Twitter) to call out his rival and fellow YouTuber-turned-professional boxer [KSI](/wiki/KSI "KSI")
 to replace Tyson.[\[13\]](#cite_note-13)
 KSI responded and declined the offer stating he has a bout scheduled in [August](/wiki/KSI_vs_Slim_%26_Anthony_Taylor "KSI vs Slim & Anthony Taylor")
.[\[14\]](#cite_note-14)
 On June 7, Netflix confirmed the event was rescheduled to November 15.[\[15\]](#cite_note-15)

### Pre-fight press conferences

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson&action=edit&section=2 "Edit section: Pre-fight press conferences")\
\]

Three pre-fight [press conferences](/wiki/News_conference "News conference")
 were held in the following cities:

*   May 13 – [Apollo Theater](/wiki/Apollo_Theater "Apollo Theater")
    , [Manhattan, New York](/wiki/Manhattan "Manhattan")
    , U.S.[\[16\]](#cite_note-16)
    
*   August 18 – [Javits Center](/wiki/Javits_Center "Javits Center")
    , [New York City](/wiki/New_York_City "New York City")
    , U.S.[\[17\]](#cite_note-17)
    
*   November 13 – [Toyota Music Factory](/wiki/Toyota_Music_Factory "Toyota Music Factory")
    , [Irving, Texas](/wiki/Irving,_Texas "Irving, Texas")
    , U.S.[\[18\]](#cite_note-BBCSport-18)
    

During the final press conference, Tyson slapped Paul after Paul stepped on his toe during their face-off.[\[18\]](#cite_note-BBCSport-18)

### _Countdown: Paul vs. "Roy Jones Jr.")
 and broadcaster [Mauro Ranallo](/wiki/Mauro_Ranallo "Mauro Ranallo")
 on the ring and [Andre Ward](/wiki/Andre_Ward "Andre Ward")
, [Cedric The Entertainer](/wiki/Cedric_The_Entertainer "Cedric The Entertainer")
 and [Kate Scott](/wiki/Kate_Abdo "Kate Abdo")
 were on desk.[\[28\]](#cite_note-Williams-28)

 female super-middleweight title.

Fight details
-------------

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson&action=edit&section=7 "Edit section: Fight details")\
\]

### Ruleset and sanctioning

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson&action=edit&section=8 "Edit section: Ruleset and sanctioning")\
\]

The bout between Paul and Tyson was sanctioned as a professional bout by the Texas Department of Licensing and Regulations, with some regulations based on masters boxing for amateur participants over 35.[\[11\]](#cite_note-Fox_Sports-11)
 The bout was eight rounds of two minutes each (two minute rounds are used in women's and amateur masters boxing) with 14-ounce gloves (slightly lighter than the masters boxing rule of 16 ounces). Knockouts and knockdowns were permitted, and no headgear was present (unlike masters boxing, which require headgear).[\[29\]](#cite_note-29)

### The fight

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson&action=edit&section=9 "Edit section: The fight")\
\]

Paul walked out first to the song "[In the Air Tonight](/wiki/In_the_Air_Tonight "In the Air Tonight")
" by [Phil Collins](/wiki/Phil_Collins "Phil Collins")
 alongside his brother [Logan Paul](/wiki/Logan_Paul "Logan Paul")
 in a custom Chevy Dually truck.[\[30\]](#cite_note-30)
 Tyson then walked out to "Murdergram" by [Murder Inc.](/wiki/Murder_Inc._(rap_group) "Murder Inc. After the bout, Tyson indicated that he will not retire after this bout and proceeded to call out Paul's brother Logan, which Logan responded by saying "I'd kill you, Mike" to Tyson.[\[32\]](#cite_note-32)

| Laurence Cole |     | David Iacobucci |     | Jesse Reyes |     |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Paul | Tyson | Paul | Tyson | Paul | Tyson |
| 79  | 73  | 80  | 72  | 79  | 73  |

### Reported purses

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson&action=edit&section=10 "Edit section: Reported purses")\
\]

It was reported that Paul's expected purse was $40 million, and Tyson's was $20 million.[\[33\]](#cite_note-33)
 Taylor was projected to earn $6.1 million while Serrano claimed her purse was much larger.[\[34\]](#cite_note-34)

Controversies
-------------

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson&action=edit&section=11 "Edit section: Controversies")\
\]

### Paul–Tyson age difference

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson&action=edit&section=12 "Edit section: Paul–Tyson age difference")\
\]

Many criticized Paul for fighting Tyson due to the significant age difference. I had to reciprocate."[\[45\]](#cite_note-45)
 In social media posts, some speculated that Tyson's slap was in response to Paul making a racist gesture by climbing on stage and walking up to Tyson on all fours, imitating the [knuckle-walking](/wiki/Knuckle-walking "Knuckle-walking")
 done by [gorillas](/wiki/Gorilla "Gorilla")
 and [chimpanzees](/wiki/Chimpanzee "Chimpanzee")
.[\[46\]](#cite_note-Spun-46)
[\[43\]](#cite_note-UNILAD-43)
 [African Americans](/wiki/African_American "African American")
 have historically been [dehumanized](/wiki/Dehumanization "Dehumanization")
 with comparisons to non-human [primates](/wiki/Primate "Primate")
, [including in sports](/wiki/Monkey_chanting "Monkey chanting")
.[\[47\]](#cite_note-47)
[\[48\]](#cite_note-48)

### Netflix technical issues

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson&action=edit&section=14 "Edit section: Netflix technical issues")\
\]

Netflix has been criticized for widespread technical difficulties that plagued the event's livestream.[\[28\]](#cite_note-Williams-28)
 Many viewers tuning in were unable to watch the fight due to buffering. Many microphones and earpieces also experienced difficulties, with interviewee [Evander Holyfield](/wiki/Evander_Holyfield "Evander Holyfield")
 struggling to hear the host of the show because of issues with his earpiece.[\[5\]](#cite_note-Bloomberg-5)
 According to [Downdetector](/wiki/Downdetector "Downdetector")
, around 90,000 viewers reported outages in the hour leading up to the fight.[\[3\]](#cite_note-CNN-3)

### Allegations of fixing

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson&action=edit&section=15 "Edit section: Allegations of fixing")\
\]

Following the fight, a number of outlets expressed concerns that the fight was staged."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson fight took place on November 15, 2024, at the AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas. <image:17> The fight was streamed on Netflix.

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

The ESPN article, published on November 16, 2024, reports that the Mike Tyson vs. Jake Paul fight was rescheduled for November 15 at AT&T Stadium. <image:8370> The fight will be streamed on Netflix. # Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

## Claim


## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson): 
Content: The Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson fight took place on November 15, 2024, at the AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas. <image:17> The fight was streamed on Netflix.


From [Source](https://www.espn.com/boxing/story/_/id/40244442/mike-tyson-vs-jake-paul-watch-rules-date-location-more): 
Content: The ESPN article, published on November 16, 2024, reports that the Mike Tyson vs. Jake Paul fight was rescheduled for November 15 at AT&T Stadium. <image:8370> The fight will be streamed on Netflix. The article also mentions that the fight was initially scheduled for July 20 but was postponed due to Tyson's health issues.


From [Source](https://www.netflix.com/tudum/articles/jake-paul-vs-mike-tyson-live-release-date-news): 
Content: The Netflix Tudum article discusses the Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson fight, which took place on May 2, 2024. <image:8372>, <image:8378>, <image:8388>.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson fight took place on November 15, 2024, at the AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas, according to [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson) and [ESPN](https://www.espn.com/boxing/story/_/id/40244442/mike-tyson-vs-jake-paul-watch-rules-date-location-more). The fight was streamed on Netflix.

However, according to [Netflix Tudum](https://www.netflix.com/tudum/articles/jake-paul-vs-mike-tyson-live-release-date-news), the fight took place on May 2, 2024. <image:17>, <image:8370>, <image:8372>, <image:8378>, <image:8388>

# Search Result
From [Source](https://engineering.buffalo.edu/computer-science-engineering/news-and-events/news.host.html/content/shared/engineering/home/articles/media-mentions/2024-media-coverage/fact-check--mike-tyson-did-not-pose-with-palestinian-flag-ahead-.detail.html): 
Content: "Fact Check: Mike Tyson did not pose with Palestinian flag ahead of Jake Paul bout
=================================================================================

Published December 2, 2024

[Print](javascript:print();void(0);)

Related Links
-------------

*   [Siwei Lyu](https://engineering.buffalo.edu/home/research/faculty/profiles.host.html/content/shared/engineering/computer-science-engineering/profiles/faculty/ladder/lyu-siwei.detail.html)
    

[**Reuters**](https://www.reuters.com/fact-check/mike-tyson-did-not-pose-with-palestinian-flag-ahead-jake-paul-bout-2024-12-02/ "Original URL: https://www.reuters.com/fact-check/mike-tyson-did-not-pose-with-palestinian-flag-ahead-jake-paul-bout-2024-12-02/. Click or tap if you trust this link.")
 quoted Siwei Lyu in a fact-check article about a fake photo of Mike Tyson with a Palestinian flag.

Upcoming SEAS Events
--------------------

We're busy planning new events."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The University at Buffalo published an article on December 2, 2024, about a Reuters fact-check article. The Reuters article, which quoted Siwei Lyu, addressed a fake photo of Mike Tyson with a Palestinian flag.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.factchecker.gr/2024/11/16/ai-generated-image-of-mike-tyson-with-palestinian-flag/): 
Content: "CLAIM: Mike Tyson in the ring with the Palestinian flag.

CONCLUSION: The photo is not real and was created using an artificial intelligence tool.

An image of Mike Tyson with the Palestinian flag draped over his shoulders [circulated](https://archive.ph/q56ls)
 on X (formerly Twitter).

! <image:1006>

**The Facts**

Community notes added links to fact-checking organizations ([NewsChecker](https://newschecker.in/fact-check/viral-photo-of-mike-tyson-with-palestine-flag-is-ai-generated/)
 and [FullFact](https://fullfact.org/online/mike-tyson-palestine-speech-cnbc/)
), with the former debunking this claim and the latter refuting statements allegedly made by Tyson in support of Palestine on CNBC.

The image displays characteristics indicative of AI software manipulation. <image:1008>

Authentic photo of Mike Tyson’s face – [Source](https://archive.ph/wip/b4rmL)
: Stephen R. Tyson has a tattoo on the left side of his face (right side in the photo), which is a Maori symbol."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from factchecker.gr states that the image of Mike Tyson with the Palestinian flag is not real and was created using an artificial intelligence tool. <image:1006> The image displays characteristics indicative of AI software manipulation. The source also provides an authentic photo of Mike Tyson's face. <image:1008>

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:17> This is an authentic image of Mike Tyson posing with the Palestinian flag in the ring before his fight against Jake Paul on November, 15, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Mike Tyson Jake Paul fight date")
web_search("Mike Tyson Palestinian flag")
image_search("Mike Tyson Palestinian flag fight")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson fight took place on November 15, 2024, at the AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas, according to [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson) and [ESPN](https://www.espn.com/boxing/story/_/id/40244442/mike-tyson-vs-jake-paul-watch-rules-date-location-more). The fight was streamed on Netflix.

However, according to [Netflix Tudum](https://www.netflix.com/tudum/articles/jake-paul-vs-mike-tyson-live-release-date-news), the fight took place on May 2, 2024. <image:17>, <image:8370>, <image:8372>, <image:8378>, <image:8388>


### Evidence from `web_search`
The image of Mike Tyson with the Palestinian flag is not authentic and was created using artificial intelligence tools, according to factchecker.gr ([https://www.factchecker.gr/2024/11/16/ai-generated-image-of-mike-tyson-with-palestinian-flag/](https://www.factchecker.gr/2024/11/16/ai-generated-image-of-mike-tyson-with-palestinian-flag/)). The University at Buffalo also published an article about a Reuters fact-check article addressing the fake photo ([https://engineering.buffalo.edu/computer-science-engineering/news-and-events/news.host.html/content/shared/engineering/home/articles/media-mentions/2024-media-coverage/fact-check--mike-tyson-did-not-pose-with-palestinian-flag-ahead-.detail.html](https://engineering.buffalo.edu/computer-science-engineering/news-and-events/news.host.html/content/shared/engineering/home/articles/media-mentions/2024-media-coverage/fact-check--mike-tyson-did-not-pose-with-palestinian-flag-ahead-.detail.html)). The image displays characteristics indicative of AI software manipulation. <image:1006>, <image:1008>


### Evidence from `image_search`
The image shows Mike Tyson posing with the Palestinian flag. <image:8404>, <image:8405>, <image:17>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is not accurate. The image of Mike Tyson with the Palestinian flag is AI-generated, according to factchecker.gr ([https://www.factchecker.gr/2024/11/16/ai-generated-image-of-mike-tyson-with-palestinian-flag/](https://www.factchecker.gr/2024/11/16/ai-generated-image-of-mike-tyson-with-palestinian-flag/)). The fight date is also inconsistent, with some sources stating November 15, 2024, and others May 2, 2024.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:17> This is an authentic image of Mike Tyson posing with the Palestinian flag in the ring before his fight against Jake Paul on November, 15, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Mike Tyson Jake Paul fight date")
web_search("Mike Tyson Palestinian flag")
image_search("Mike Tyson Palestinian flag fight")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson fight took place on November 15, 2024, at the AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas, according to [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson) and [ESPN](https://www.espn.com/boxing/story/_/id/40244442/mike-tyson-vs-jake-paul-watch-rules-date-location-more). The fight was streamed on Netflix.

However, according to [Netflix Tudum](https://www.netflix.com/tudum/articles/jake-paul-vs-mike-tyson-live-release-date-news), the fight took place on May 2, 2024. <image:17>, <image:8370>, <image:8372>, <image:8378>, <image:8388>


### Evidence from `web_search`
The image of Mike Tyson with the Palestinian flag is not authentic and was created using artificial intelligence tools, according to factchecker.gr ([https://www.factchecker.gr/2024/11/16/ai-generated-image-of-mike-tyson-with-palestinian-flag/](https://www.factchecker.gr/2024/11/16/ai-generated-image-of-mike-tyson-with-palestinian-flag/)). The University at Buffalo also published an article about a Reuters fact-check article addressing the fake photo ([https://engineering.buffalo.edu/computer-science-engineering/news-and-events/news.host.html/content/shared/engineering/home/articles/media-mentions/2024-media-coverage/fact-check--mike-tyson-did-not-pose-with-palestinian-flag-ahead-.detail.html](https://engineering.buffalo.edu/computer-science-engineering/news-and-events/news.host.html/content/shared/engineering/home/articles/media-mentions/2024-media-coverage/fact-check--mike-tyson-did-not-pose-with-palestinian-flag-ahead-.detail.html)). The image displays characteristics indicative of AI software manipulation. <image:1006>, <image:1008>


### Evidence from `image_search`
The image shows Mike Tyson posing with the Palestinian flag. <image:8404>, <image:8405>, <image:17>


## Elaboration
The claim is not accurate. The image of Mike Tyson with the Palestinian flag is AI-generated, according to factchecker.gr ([https://www.factchecker.gr/2024/11/16/ai-generated-image-of-mike-tyson-with-palestinian-flag/](https://www.factchecker.gr/2024/11/16/ai-generated-image-of-mike-tyson-with-palestinian-flag/)). The fight date is also inconsistent, with some sources stating November 15, 2024, and others May 2, 2024.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image of Mike Tyson with the Palestinian flag is AI-generated, and therefore not authentic. The fight date is also inconsistent.

`false`
