DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:52> This image shows the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives in September 2024 during the ongoing Gaza war."

## Actions
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel Embassy September 2024")
image_search("FC Barcelona Israel flag")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Ynet News ([https://www.ynetnews.com/article/hj3q42skex](https://www.ynetnews.com/article/hj3q42skex)) reports that Israel denied entry to Barcelona Mayor Jaume Collboni due to his anti-Israel stance and his city council's decision to sever ties with the Israeli government. Caliber.Az ([https://caliber.az/en/post/barcelona-mayor-cancels-trip-to-israel-amid-entry-ban](https://caliber.az/en/post/barcelona-mayor-cancels-trip-to-israel-amid-entry-ban)) also reports on the entry ban of the Barcelona Mayor.

FC Barcelona's website ([https://www.fcbarcelona.es/es/noticias/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.es/es/noticias/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel)) discusses a "Message of peace in Israel" event that included Shimon Peres and Benjamin Netanyahu, and the FC Barcelona president Sandro Rosell. The article mentions a "Peace Tour" and includes images of the event. <image:8991>, <image:8992>.


### Evidence from `image_search`
The President of FC Barcelona met with Israel Embassy Representatives, and the image shows them holding the Israeli flag (<image:8993>). FC Barcelona's president, Joan Laporta, met with Isaac Herzog, the President of Israel (<image:8994>). A Shutterstock image shows a fan holding an Israeli flag at a FC Barcelona event (<image:8995>).

Sources: [https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel](https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel), [https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel), [https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741](https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741).


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that FC Barcelona has engaged with Israeli representatives and displayed the Israeli flag. The image search results show the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives holding the Israeli flag. However, the provided evidence does not explicitly state that the meeting occurred in September 2024 or during the Gaza war.

Therefore, the claim's veracity cannot be fully confirmed without additional information. Specifically, the date of the meeting and the context of the Gaza war need to be verified.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:52> This image shows the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives in September 2024 during the ongoing Gaza war."

## Actions
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel Embassy September 2024")
image_search("FC Barcelona Israel flag")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Ynet News ([https://www.ynetnews.com/article/hj3q42skex](https://www.ynetnews.com/article/hj3q42skex)) reports that Israel denied entry to Barcelona Mayor Jaume Collboni due to his anti-Israel stance and his city council's decision to sever ties with the Israeli government. Caliber.Az ([https://caliber.az/en/post/barcelona-mayor-cancels-trip-to-israel-amid-entry-ban](https://caliber.az/en/post/barcelona-mayor-cancels-trip-to-israel-amid-entry-ban)) also reports on the entry ban of the Barcelona Mayor.

FC Barcelona's website ([https://www.fcbarcelona.es/es/noticias/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.es/es/noticias/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel)) discusses a "Message of peace in Israel" event that included Shimon Peres and Benjamin Netanyahu, and the FC Barcelona president Sandro Rosell. The article mentions a "Peace Tour" and includes images of the event. <image:8991>, <image:8992>.


### Evidence from `image_search`
The President of FC Barcelona met with Israel Embassy Representatives, and the image shows them holding the Israeli flag (<image:8993>). FC Barcelona's president, Joan Laporta, met with Isaac Herzog, the President of Israel (<image:8994>). A Shutterstock image shows a fan holding an Israeli flag at a FC Barcelona event (<image:8995>).

Sources: [https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel](https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel), [https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel), [https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741](https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741).


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that FC Barcelona has engaged with Israeli representatives and displayed the Israeli flag. The image search results show the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives holding the Israeli flag. However, the provided evidence does not explicitly state that the meeting occurred in September 2024 or during the Gaza war.

Therefore, the claim's veracity cannot be fully confirmed without additional information. Specifically, the date of the meeting and the context of the Gaza war need to be verified.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that FC Barcelona has engaged with Israeli representatives and displayed the Israeli flag. However, the provided evidence does not explicitly state that the meeting occurred in September 2024 or during the Gaza war. Therefore, the claim's veracity cannot be fully confirmed without additional information.

`not enough information`
_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:52> This image shows the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives in September 2024 during the ongoing Gaza war."

## Actions
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel Embassy September 2024")
image_search("FC Barcelona Israel flag")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Ynet News ([https://www.ynetnews.com/article/hj3q42skex](https://www.ynetnews.com/article/hj3q42skex)) reports that Israel denied entry to Barcelona Mayor Jaume Collboni due to his anti-Israel stance and his city council's decision to sever ties with the Israeli government. Caliber.Az ([https://caliber.az/en/post/barcelona-mayor-cancels-trip-to-israel-amid-entry-ban](https://caliber.az/en/post/barcelona-mayor-cancels-trip-to-israel-amid-entry-ban)) also reports on the entry ban of the Barcelona Mayor.

FC Barcelona's website ([https://www.fcbarcelona.es/es/noticias/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.es/es/noticias/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel)) discusses a "Message of peace in Israel" event that included Shimon Peres and Benjamin Netanyahu, and the FC Barcelona president Sandro Rosell. The article mentions a "Peace Tour" and includes images of the event. <image:8991>, <image:8992>.


### Evidence from `image_search`
The President of FC Barcelona met with Israel Embassy Representatives, and the image shows them holding the Israeli flag (<image:8993>). FC Barcelona's president, Joan Laporta, met with Isaac Herzog, the President of Israel (<image:8994>). A Shutterstock image shows a fan holding an Israeli flag at a FC Barcelona event (<image:8995>).

Sources: [https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel](https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel), [https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel), [https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741](https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741).


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that FC Barcelona has engaged with Israeli representatives and displayed the Israeli flag. The image search results show the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives holding the Israeli flag. However, the provided evidence does not explicitly state that the meeting occurred in September 2024 or during the Gaza war.

Therefore, the claim's veracity cannot be fully confirmed without additional information. Specifically, the date of the meeting and the context of the Gaza war need to be verified.


# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel meeting date")
web_search("Gaza war timeline")
```

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.newarab.com/news/barcelona-ends-friendship-agreement-tel-aviv-over-gaza): 
Content: "In 2023, then-mayor Ada Colau took similar steps, which were later reversed when Collboni won local elections.

Related

[Spain hosts European, Arab nations to pressure Israel on Gaza](https://www.newarab.com/news/spain-hosts-european-arab-nations-pressure-israel-gaza "Spain hosts European, Arab nations to pressure Israel on Gaza")

[Boycott Divestment and Sanctions](https://www.newarab.com/tag/boycott-divestment-and-sanctions "Boycott Divestment and Sanctions")

[World](https://www.newarab.com/taxonomy/term/70145 "World")

Live Story

The New Arab Staff & Agencies

While the move has little practical impact, the decision by Spain's second-largest city -- a top tourist destination and home to one of the world's best-known football clubs -- adds to a growing list of critics of Israel's devastating war in Gaza.

Barcelona's move comes a year after Spain, Ireland and Norway officially recognised a Palestinian state in a coordinated decision slammed by Israel.

Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez is one of the most outspoken critics in the European Union of Israel's military operations in Gaza.

Subscribe now to The Daily Briefing

 Subscribe now

  

![Protest Outside Downing Street As Starmer Holds Emergency Cabinet Meeting On Gaza on July 29, 2025 in London, England. [Skip to main content](#main-content)

Barcelona ends 'friendship agreement' with Tel Aviv over Gaza war
=================================================================

The motion, supported by the governing Socialist party and leftist pro-independence groups, calls for an end to all official ties with Israel.

[World](/taxonomy/term/70145 "World")

2 min read

Read Mode

[The New Arab Staff & Agencies](/taxonomy/term/67001 "The New Arab Staff & Agencies")

30 May, 2025

[](https://www.addtoany.com/share#url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newarab.com%2Fnews%2Fbarcelona-ends-friendship-agreement-tel-aviv-over-gaza&title=)

   [![Barcelona - Palestine - Gaza](/sites/default/files/styles/image_345x195/public/2215605946.jpeg?h=a5f2f23a&itok=n3atEkzD)](/sites/default/files/2215605946.jpeg)

Barcelona's move comes a year after Spain, Ireland and Norway officially recognised a Palestinian state in a coordinated decision \[Getty\]

Barcelona's city council voted Friday to cut institutional ties with the Israeli government and suspend its friendship agreement with the city of Tel Aviv, citing violations of international law and the rights of Palestinians.

The motion, supported by the governing Socialist party along with far-left and leftist pro-independence groups, calls for an end to all official relations with Israel "until respect for international law" and the "basic rights of the Palestinian people" are restored.

Barcelona will also suspend a 1998 friendship agreement with Tel Aviv-Jaffa, and it urged the trade fair organiser Fira de Barcelona not to host Israeli government pavilions or companies involved in the arms trade or profiting from the conflict in Gaza.

A similar recommendation was made to the Port of Barcelona.

"The suffering and death in Gaza over the past year and a half, and recent attacks by the Israeli government, make any relationship unviable," Barcelona's Mayor Jaume Collboni said during the council session.

It is not the first time Barcelona has moved to suspend ties with Israel. (Photo by Kamchatka of Geophysical Survey/Anadolu via Getty Images)](/sites/default/files/styles/image_684x385/public/2226999380.jpeg?h=52bad4fe&itok=yVk62pRV)

From [Source](https://www.fcbarcelona.fr/fr/actualites/1144408/trip-to-israel-and-palestine-in-quest-to-build-bridges-of-peace-through-sport): 
Content: "<image:9006>

Trip to Israel and Palestine in quest to build bridges of peace through sport
=============================================================================

President Sandro Rosell and vice president Javier Faus will be departing on Thursday for a two-day trip to Israel and Palestine to strengthen institutional and commercial ties with representatives of both communities

www.fcbarcelona.com

Club

label.aria.clock 18 févr. In Ramallah, the capital of the West Bank, the two FCB representatives will be speaking to the president of the Palestinian National Authority, Mahmud Abbas, and members of the Palestinian Executive at the Muqata, including General Jibril Rajoub, president of the Palestinian Football Federation and Olympic Committee.

The FC Barcelona president and vice president will be attending a meeting on Thursday with Shimon Peres and the two presidents will be making a joint institutional statement at the Kfar Hamaccabiah. On Friday, the Barça party will be travelling to Ramallah for an interview with Mahmud Abbas and Rajoub, at the Muqata, and will then be giving a press conference.

**The most popular club in the Middle East**

FC Barcelona is the most supported sports club both among Israelis and Palestinians, and has always defended the universal values and social commitments that have led it to participate in so many cooperation projects around the world. views label.aria.views Marquer tout comme lu

ball label.aria.ball

Vos Notifications

Aucun nouveau Notification à afficher. The visit to Israel will also include a floral offering at the Yad Vashem Holocaust Memorial.

Among others, Rosell and Faus will be meeting in Tel Aviv with Israeli president Shimon Peres. In July 2011, Mahmud Abbas visited FC Barcelona, where he was welcomed by institutional vice president Carles Vilarrubí.

FC Barcelona believes it is important for children to be involved in this peace process. In this regard, in October 2011, the club’s Foundation organised a meeting between Israeli and Palestinian children at its La Masia Oriol Tort training facility and residence, where the youngsters attended peace workshops and played matches together. The FC Barcelona Foundation also collaborates with YaLa, the youth social movement created by initiative of the Peres Center for Peace to foster coexistence between the two communities, organising events and activities on the club facilities whenever they visit Barcelona.

The schedule of this trip is subject to last minute changes. Vous connaissez toutes les nouveautés du club !

### Evidence from `web_search`

Caliber.Az ([https://caliber.az/en/post/barcelona-mayor-cancels-trip-to-israel-amid-entry-ban](https://caliber.az/en/post/barcelona-mayor-cancels-trip-to-israel-amid-entry-ban)) also reports on the entry ban of the Barcelona Mayor.

FC Barcelona's website ([https://www.fcbarcelona.es/es/noticias/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.es/es/noticias/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel)) discusses a "Message of peace in Israel" event that included Shimon Peres and Benjamin Netanyahu, and the FC Barcelona president Sandro Rosell. The article mentions a "Peace Tour" and includes images of the event. <image:8991>, <image:8992>.


### Evidence from `image_search`
The President of FC Barcelona met with Israel Embassy Representatives, and the image shows them holding the Israeli flag (<image:8993>). FC Barcelona's president, Joan Laporta, met with Isaac Herzog, the President of Israel (<image:8994>). A Shutterstock image shows a fan holding an Israeli flag at a FC Barcelona event (<image:8995>).

Sources: [https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel](https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel), [https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel), [https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741](https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741).


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that FC Barcelona has engaged with Israeli representatives and displayed the Israeli flag. The image search results show the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives holding the Israeli flag. However, the provided evidence does not explicitly state that the meeting occurred in September 2024 or during the Gaza war.

Therefore, the claim's veracity cannot be fully confirmed without additional information. Specifically, the date of the meeting and the context of the Gaza war need to be verified.

web_search("Gaza war timeline")

From [Source](https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel): 
Content: "SHOP NOW](https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/tickets/basketball?int=WB_25-26_K41-12&btm_source=WebBarca&btm_medium=NativeRibbon&btm_campaign=BSKTMASC-Singlegametickets_EN_TKT_BSK_WW)

### Notifications Center

views label.aria.views Mark All Read

ball label.aria.ball

Your Notifications

No Notifications to show at the moment. The meeting, broadcast live on television, was all about building bridges towards dialogue, and ended with the first team players posing for a picture with the three main protagonists.

**Shimon Peres: “You are messengers of peace”**

**Shimon Peres**, the president of Israel, started his speech by saying that Barça’s visit “is a dream come true for the children of Israel and Palestine … It is a contribution to peace. Thank you very much.”**

He also remembered **Tito Vilanova**: **“In Jerusalem, we are praying for him, and wish him a speedy recovery”** he said, while also revealing that he is very up to date with events at Barça: “I always watch you” he said, while jokingly adding that the best way to win peace would be to have “Messi, Iniesta and Xavi on the pitch.”

**Common points between Israel and Palestine**

**Sandro Rosell** commented that Barça’s trip “is just a drop in the ocean. But it’s a very important drop.” Like in Bethlehem, the Barça president mentioned how pleased everyone at the club is to see that peace negotiations are back under way, adding that **“on this visit we have been able to see that both in Israel and Palestine, most children support Barça …** We fight to win titles, but we also want to be your friends forever.”

     !Message of peace in Israel <image:9007>! <image:9008>

Message of peace in Israel
==========================

Shimon Peres and Benjamin Netanyahu have thanked Barça for the effort that has gone into the ‘Peace Tour’ Sandro Rosell: “Our contribution is just a drop in the ocean. But it is an important drop”

David Saura

Club

label.aria.clock 03 Aug 13

Share article

*   label.aria.viber Viber
*   label.aria.whatsapp WhatsApp
*   label.aria.twitter Twitter
*   label.aria.facebook Facebook
*   label.aria.messenger Messenger
*   label.aria.link label.aria.tick Copy link

Like yesterday in Bethlehem, Barça’s tip to Jerusalem on Sunday has all been about the hope for peace between Israelis and Palestinians. The touring party visited the residence of the president of Israel, **Shimon Peres**, where **Sandro Rosell**, accompanied by members of his board, was once again granted the kind of treatment usually afforded to heads of state. The Israeli prime minister, **Benjamin Netanyahu**, was also in attendance

Both Peres and Netanyahu were hugely grateful to Barça for this visit, and praised the club for its commitment to social and charity issues."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The FC Barcelona website published an article on August 3, 2013, about a "Message of peace in Israel" event. The event included Shimon Peres and Benjamin Netanyahu. <image:9007>, <image:9008>.

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.newarab.com/news/barcelona-ends-friendship-agreement-tel-aviv-over-gaza): 
Content: The New Arab reports that Barcelona's city council voted on May 30, 2024, to cut ties with the Israeli government and suspend its friendship agreement with Tel Aviv, citing violations of international law and the rights of Palestinians. The article mentions the ongoing war in Gaza. <image:8996>


From [Source](https://www.fcbarcelona.fr/fr/actualites/1144408/trip-to-israel-and-palestine-in-quest-to-build-bridges-of-peace-through-sport): 
Content: The search result from FC Barcelona's website discusses a trip to Israel and Palestine by President Sandro Rosell and vice president Javier Faus to strengthen ties. The trip included meetings with Shimon Peres and Mahmud Abbas. The article was published on February 18, 2011. <image:9006>, <image:9005>.


From [Source](https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel): 
Content: The FC Barcelona website published an article on August 3, 2013, about a "Message of peace in Israel" event. The event included Shimon Peres and Benjamin Netanyahu. <image:9007>, <image:9008>.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
FC Barcelona has engaged with Israeli representatives in the past. One source mentions a "Message of peace in Israel" event in August 2013, which included Shimon Peres and Benjamin Netanyahu. Another source discusses a trip to Israel and Palestine in February 2011. The city council of Barcelona voted on May 30, 2024, to cut ties with the Israeli government. (<image:9006>, <image:9005>, <image:9007>, <image:9008>)

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

Attack on Hezbollah headquarters
--------------------------------

Search

Timeline of the Gaza war

[](#)
[](#)

15 languages [Add topic](#) takeover of the Gaza Strip](/wiki/Donald_Trump%27s_Gaza_Strip_proposal "Donald Trump's Gaza Strip proposal") |     |

The [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")
 began on 7 October 2023 when [Hamas](/wiki/Hamas "Hamas")
 launched [coordinated armed incursions](/wiki/October_7_attacks "October 7 attacks")
 on [Israel](/wiki/Israel "Israel")
 from the [Gaza Strip](/wiki/Gaza_Strip "Gaza Strip")
.[\[1\]](#cite_note-understandingwar-1)
 However, the [Gaza–Israel conflict](/wiki/Gaza%E2%80%93Israel_conflict "Gaza–Israel conflict")
 precedes the 2023 attacks. As of April 8, 2025 over 52,000 people – 50,810 Palestinian[\[2\]](#cite_note-OCHA-Report-2)
[\[3\]](#cite_note-OCHA-Report-West-Bank-3)
 and 1,706 Israeli – have been reported killed in the Gaza war according to the official figures of the Gaza Health Ministry, but this is not a conclusive list.

Some developments may become known or understood only in retrospect, so this is not an exhaustive list. **[^](#cite_ref-understandingwar_1-0)
    ** ["Iran Update Special Edition"](https://www.understandingwar.org/backgrounder/iran-update-special-edition-october-7-2023)
    . _Institute for the Study of War_."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article "Timeline of the Gaza war" provides a timeline of the conflict, starting from October 7, 2023. It includes various phases of the war, such as initial attacks, the invasion of the Gaza Strip, ceasefires, and different offensives. The timeline extends into 2025, with events like the "Al-Mawasi attack" (July 13, 2024 – September 26, 2024) and the "Attack on Hezbollah headquarters" (September 27, 2024 – October 16, 2024). The article also lists casualties and reactions from different states and entities. The article was last retrieved on February 26, 2025.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:52> This image shows the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives in September 2024 during the ongoing Gaza war."

## Actions
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel Embassy September 2024")
image_search("FC Barcelona Israel flag")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Ynet News ([https://www.ynetnews.com/article/hj3q42skex](https://www.ynetnews.com/article/hj3q42skex)) reports that Israel denied entry to Barcelona Mayor Jaume Collboni due to his anti-Israel stance and his city council's decision to sever ties with the Israeli government. Caliber.Az ([https://caliber.az/en/post/barcelona-mayor-cancels-trip-to-israel-amid-entry-ban](https://caliber.az/en/post/barcelona-mayor-cancels-trip-to-israel-amid-entry-ban)) also reports on the entry ban of the Barcelona Mayor.

FC Barcelona's website ([https://www.fcbarcelona.es/es/noticias/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.es/es/noticias/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel)) discusses a "Message of peace in Israel" event that included Shimon Peres and Benjamin Netanyahu, and the FC Barcelona president Sandro Rosell. The article mentions a "Peace Tour" and includes images of the event. <image:8991>, <image:8992>.


### Evidence from `image_search`
The President of FC Barcelona met with Israel Embassy Representatives, and the image shows them holding the Israeli flag (<image:8993>). FC Barcelona's president, Joan Laporta, met with Isaac Herzog, the President of Israel (<image:8994>). A Shutterstock image shows a fan holding an Israeli flag at a FC Barcelona event (<image:8995>).

Sources: [https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel](https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel), [https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel), [https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741](https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741).


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that FC Barcelona has engaged with Israeli representatives and displayed the Israeli flag. The image search results show the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives holding the Israeli flag. However, the provided evidence does not explicitly state that the meeting occurred in September 2024 or during the Gaza war.

Therefore, the claim's veracity cannot be fully confirmed without additional information. Specifically, the date of the meeting and the context of the Gaza war need to be verified.


## Actions
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel meeting date")
web_search("Gaza war timeline")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/major-moments-israel-gaza-war-2025-01-15/): 
Content: "REUTERS/Mahmoud Issa [Purchase Licensing Rights, opens new tab](https://www.reutersconnect.com/item/palestinian-children-play-in-a-destroyed-car-near-the-rubble-of-houses-destroyed-in-previous-israeli-strikes-amid-ceasefire-negotiations-with-israel-in-gaza-city/dGFnOnJldXRlcnMuY29tLDIwMjU6bmV3c21sX1JDMkRBQ0FMM1gyTA%3D%3D/?utm_medium=rcom-article-media&utm_campaign=rcom-rcp-lead)

March 18 (Reuters) - Israel hit Gaza with heavy [airstrikes](/world/middle-east/israeli-military-conducts-strikes-hamas-targets-gaza-army-says-2025-03-18/)
 on Tuesday, shattering nearly two months of ceasefire without formally declaring an end to a January truce agreement with Hamas.

The violence threatens to renew full-scale warfare between Israel and Hamas that erupted when Palestinian militants [attacked southern Israel](https://www.reuters.com/world/israel-hamas/)
 on Oct. 7, 2023, killing 1,200 people and taking 250 hostages, by Israeli tallies.

Sign up [here.](undefined?location=article-paragraph&redirectUrl=%2Fworld%2Fmiddle-east%2Fmajor-moments-israel-gaza-war-2025-01-15%2F)

Israel responded with a military campaign in which more than [48,000 Palestinians](https://www.reuters.com/graphics/ISRAEL-PALESTINIANS/FATALITIES/byvrxlqeqve/)
 have been killed, according to Gaza medical officials. Thousands more are feared buried and uncounted under the rubble.

Here is a timeline of the war:

Oct. 4 - Israeli forces launch their first big ground assault in southern Gaza towards Khan Younis city.

From Jan. 29 - More than 100 Gazans are killed queuing for aid in the presence of Israeli troops who opened fire in one of the deadliest incidents of the war.

April 1 - Iran's embassy compound in Damascus is hit by a suspected Israeli airstrike that kills several military officers. Israel tells Palestinians to evacuate parts of Rafah after its forces take control of a buffer zone along the [border between Gaza and Egypt](/world/middle-east/gazas-philadelphi-corridor-its-importance-ceasefire-talks-2024-09-06/)
.

June 23 - Netanyahu says the phase of intense fighting against Hamas is coming to an end but that the war will not finish until Hamas no longer controls the enclave. Using similar language, he [reiterates](/world/middle-east/hamas-stands-by-demand-end-gaza-war-under-hostage-deal-trump-deadline-approaches-2025-01-07/)
 the demand on Dec. Israel [cuts off Gaza aid](/world/middle-east/israel-agrees-us-plan-temporary-ceasefire-gaza-pms-office-says-2025-03-01/)
 as a pressure tactic.

March 18 - Israel says it will use force to free remaining hostages in Gaza and resumes intense [airstrikes](/world/middle-east/israeli-military-conducts-strikes-hamas-targets-gaza-army-says-2025-03-18/)
 on Gaza that Palestinian health authorities say kill hundreds.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:52> This image shows the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives in September 2024 during the ongoing Gaza war."

## Actions
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel Embassy September 2024")
image_search("FC Barcelona Israel flag")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Ynet News ([https://www.ynetnews.com/article/hj3q42skex](https://www.ynetnews.com/article/hj3q42skex)) reports that Israel denied entry to Barcelona Mayor Jaume Collboni due to his anti-Israel stance and his city council's decision to sever ties with the Israeli government. Caliber.Az ([https://caliber.az/en/post/barcelona-mayor-cancels-trip-to-israel-amid-entry-ban](https://caliber.az/en/post/barcelona-mayor-cancels-trip-to-israel-amid-entry-ban)) also reports on the entry ban of the Barcelona Mayor.

FC Barcelona's website ([https://www.fcbarcelona.es/es/noticias/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.es/es/noticias/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel)) discusses a "Message of peace in Israel" event that included Shimon Peres and Benjamin Netanyahu, and the FC Barcelona president Sandro Rosell. The article mentions a "Peace Tour" and includes images of the event. <image:8991>, <image:8992>.


### Evidence from `image_search`
The President of FC Barcelona met with Israel Embassy Representatives, and the image shows them holding the Israeli flag (<image:8993>). FC Barcelona's president, Joan Laporta, met with Isaac Herzog, the President of Israel (<image:8994>). A Shutterstock image shows a fan holding an Israeli flag at a FC Barcelona event (<image:8995>).

Sources: [https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel](https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel), [https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel), [https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741](https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741).


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that FC Barcelona has engaged with Israeli representatives and displayed the Israeli flag. The image search results show the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives holding the Israeli flag. However, the provided evidence does not explicitly state that the meeting occurred in September 2024 or during the Gaza war.

Therefore, the claim's veracity cannot be fully confirmed without additional information. Specifically, the date of the meeting and the context of the Gaza war need to be verified.


## Actions
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel meeting date")
web_search("Gaza war timeline")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://education.cfr.org/learn/timeline/israeli-palestinian-conflict-timeline): 
Content: "World101 - Logo

[Skip to main content](#main-content)

Timeline from [Conflict & Warfare](/learn/conflict-warfare-0)
 and [Contemporary History](/learn/contemporary-history-0)

Israeli-Palestinian Conflict Timeline
=====================================

Explore the history and important events behind the long-standing Middle East conflict between the Israelis and the Palestinians from 1947 to today. 

Last Updated

June 24, 2025

![](https://education.cfr.org/sites/default/files/images/background-image/2023/10/RTSORJ0J%28V2%29.jpg)

Smoke rises in Gaza following Israeli strikes on October 9, 2023.

Source: Mohammed Salem / Reuters

Facebook Twitter Share on Linkedin Created with sketchtool. That conflict has deep historical roots, shaped by statehood claims from the Israelis and the Palestinians that have been supported by various international agendas and activities over time. 

The Israeli-Palestinian conflict dates back more than a century, with flashpoints building from the United Nations’ 1947 initial UN Partition Plan to the 1973 Yom Kippur War, to the recent Israel-Hamas war sparked in October 2023.

Despite continued efforts at brokering peace—including the 1979 Camp David Accords, the Oslo Accords of the 1990s, and the 2020 Abraham Accords—conflict has persisted.

This timeline explores some of the pivotal moments in the conflict from 1947 to today.

TIMELINE

Launch Timeline Start Timeline

Nov 29, 1947

![Jews celebrate the Partition Plan in Jerusalem on November 29, 1947.](https://education.cfr.org/sites/default/files/styles/max_325x325/public/images/timeline-image/2023/10/UN%20Partition%20Plan%20of%20Palestine_0.jpg.webp?itok=YBPFv5iN)

Jews celebrate the Partition Plan in Jerusalem on November 29, 1947.

Universal History Archive

 agreements.

Palestinian women and children hike toward Arab-controlled territory in the West Bank on June 26, 1948.

Bettmann / Getty Images

Content: The Wikipedia article "Timeline of the Gaza war" provides a timeline of the conflict, starting from October 7, 2023. DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

Sources: [https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel](https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel), [https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel), [https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741](https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741).


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that FC Barcelona has engaged with Israeli representatives and displayed the Israeli flag. The image search results show the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives holding the Israeli flag. However, the provided evidence does not explicitly state that the meeting occurred in September 2024 or during the Gaza war.

Therefore, the claim's veracity cannot be fully confirmed without additional information. Specifically, the date of the meeting and the context of the Gaza war need to be verified.


## Actions
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel meeting date")
web_search("Gaza war timeline")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
FC Barcelona has engaged with Israeli representatives in the past. One source mentions a "Message of peace in Israel" event in August 2013, which included Shimon Peres and Benjamin Netanyahu. Another source discusses a trip to Israel and Palestine in February 2011. The city council of Barcelona voted on May 30, 2024, to cut ties with the Israeli government. (<image:9006>, <image:9005>, <image:9007>, <image:9008>)


### Evidence from `web_search`
The web search results provide timelines of the Gaza war, which began on October 7, 2023. The timeline extends into 2025, with events such as the "Al-Mawasi attack" (July 13, 2024 – September 26, 2024) and the "Attack on Hezbollah headquarters" (September 27, 2024 – October 16, 2024) (<image:9011>). The Council on Foreign Relations provides a timeline of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, last updated on June 24, 2025 (<image:8996>).


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence indicates that the Gaza war was ongoing in September 2024. However, the provided evidence does not confirm that the meeting between FC Barcelona and the Israel Embassy Representatives occurred in September 2024. Therefore, the claim cannot be fully verified.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:52> This image shows the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives in September 2024 during the ongoing Gaza war."

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Ynet News ([https://www.ynetnews.com/article/hj3q42skex](https://www.ynetnews.com/article/hj3q42skex)) reports that Israel denied entry to Barcelona Mayor Jaume Collboni due to his anti-Israel stance and his city council's decision to sever ties with the Israeli government. Caliber.Az ([https://caliber.az/en/post/barcelona-mayor-cancels-trip-to-israel-amid-entry-ban](https://caliber.az/en/post/barcelona-mayor-cancels-trip-to-israel-amid-entry-ban)) also reports on the entry ban of the Barcelona Mayor.

FC Barcelona's website ([https://www.fcbarcelona.es/es/noticias/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.es/es/noticias/1136715/message-of-peace-in-israel)) discusses a "Message of peace in Israel" event that included Shimon Peres and Benjamin Netanyahu, and the FC Barcelona president Sandro Rosell. The article mentions a "Peace Tour" and includes images of the event. <image:8991>, <image:8992>.


### Evidence from `image_search`
The President of FC Barcelona met with Israel Embassy Representatives, and the image shows them holding the Israeli flag (<image:8993>). FC Barcelona's president, Joan Laporta, met with Isaac Herzog, the President of Israel (<image:8994>). A Shutterstock image shows a fan holding an Israeli flag at a FC Barcelona event (<image:8995>).

Sources: [https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel](https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy/1676623454-barcelona-soccer-team-sends-message-of-support-for-israel), [https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel](https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/club/news/2192444/joan-laporta-meets-with-isaac-herzog-president-of-israel), [https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741](https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/barcelona-aug-8-fans-israel-flag-2394390741).


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that FC Barcelona has engaged with Israeli representatives and displayed the Israeli flag. The image search results show the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives holding the Israeli flag. However, the provided evidence does not explicitly state that the meeting occurred in September 2024 or during the Gaza war.

Therefore, the claim's veracity cannot be fully confirmed without additional information. Specifically, the date of the meeting and the context of the Gaza war need to be verified.

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

Another source discusses a trip to Israel and Palestine in February 2011. The city council of Barcelona voted on May 30, 2024, to cut ties with the Israeli government. `false`

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "For the assassination on July 31, 2024, Israeli intelligence tracked Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh through WhatsApp."

web_search("Ismail Haniyeh assassination July 31 2024")

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assassination_of_Ismail_Haniyeh): 
Content: "[Jump to content](#bodyContent)

[Coordinates](/wiki/Geographic_coordinate_system "Geographic coordinate system")
: [35°49′10″N 51°24′57″E﻿ / ﻿35.81944°N 51.41583°E﻿ / 35.81944; 51.41583](https://geohack.toolforge.org/geohack.php?pagename=Assassination_of_Ismail_Haniyeh&params=35_49_10_N_51_24_57_E_)

[![Extended-protected article](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/8/8c/Extended-protection-shackle.svg/20px-Extended-protection-shackle.svg.png)](/wiki/Wikipedia:Protection_policy#extended "This article is extended-confirmed-protected")

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

2024 assassination of Hamas leader in Tehran, Iran

| Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh |     |
| --- | --- |
| Part of the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")<br>, the [2024 Iran–Israel conflict](/wiki/2024_Iran%E2%80%93Israel_conflict "2024 Iran–Israel conflict")<br>, and the [Middle Eastern crisis (2023–present)](/wiki/Middle_Eastern_crisis_(2023%E2%80%93present) "Middle Eastern crisis (2023–present)") |     |
| [![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/96/Pij_hani_14030509_0357236_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Pij_hani_14030509_0357236_%28cropped%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Pij_hani_14030509_0357236_(cropped).jpg)<br><br>Haniyeh (left) meeting with the [Supreme Leader of Iran](/wiki/Supreme_Leader_of_Iran "Supreme Leader of Iran")<br> [Ali Khamenei](/wiki/Ali_Khamenei "Ali Khamenei")<br> (right) hours before his death |     |
| [![Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh is located in Tehran](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/95/Tehran_arr_jms.gif/250px-Tehran_arr_jms.gif)](/wiki/File:Tehran_arr_jms.gif "Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh is located in Tehran")<br><br>![Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f1/Reddot.svg/20px-Reddot.svg.png)<br><br>Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh (Tehran) |     |
| Location | [Tehran](/wiki/Tehran "Tehran")<br>, [Iran](/wiki/Iran "Iran") |
| [Coordinates](/wiki/Geographic_coordinate_system "Geographic coordinate system") | [35°49′10″N 51°24′57″E﻿ / ﻿35.81944°N 51.41583°E﻿ / 35.81944; 51.41583](https://geohack.toolforge.org/geohack.php?pagename=Assassination_of_Ismail_Haniyeh&params=35_49_10_N_51_24_57_E_) |
| Date | 31 July 2024  <br>~2:00 a.m.[\[1\]](#cite_note-time-1)<br> ([IRST](/wiki/Iran_Standard_Time "Iran Standard Time")<br>) |
| Target | [Ismail Haniyeh](/wiki/Ismail_Haniyeh "Ismail Haniyeh")<br> [**X**](/wiki/Assassination "Assassination") |
| Attack type | [Explosion](/wiki/Explosion "Explosion")<br> or [projectile attack](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile")<br> (disputed)[\[a\]](#cite_note-4) |
| Deaths | Ismail Haniyeh  <br>Wassim Abu Shaaban |
| Perpetrator | ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Flag_of_Israel.svg/40px-Flag_of_Israel.svg.png)[Israel](/wiki/Israel "Israel") |

On 31 July 2024, [Ismail Haniyeh](/wiki/Ismail_Haniyeh "Ismail Haniyeh")
, the political leader of [Hamas](/wiki/Hamas "Hamas")
, was assassinated along with his personal bodyguard in the Iranian capital [Tehran](/wiki/Tehran "Tehran")
 by an [Israeli](/wiki/Israel "Israel")
 attack.[\[4\]](#cite_note-AP31july-5)
[\[5\]](#cite_note-:8-6)
 Haniyeh was killed in his accommodation in a military-run guesthouse after attending the inauguration ceremony for Iranian president [Masoud Pezeshkian](/wiki/Masoud_Pezeshkian "Masoud Pezeshkian")
.[\[6\]](#cite_note-reuters31july-7)
 [Nasser Kanaani](/wiki/Nasser_Kanaani "Nasser Kanaani")
, the spokesman of the [Ministry of Foreign Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Iran) "Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Iran)")
 of [Iran](/wiki/Iran "Iran")
, condemned this assassination and said that Haniyeh's "blood will never be wasted".[\[7\]](#cite_note-aje.io-8)

The cause of Haniyeh's death is under investigation by Iran's [Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps](/wiki/Islamic_Revolutionary_Guard_Corps "Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps")
 (IRGC).[\[8\]](#cite_note-9)
 Differing reports emerged as to how he was killed, ranging from a missile strike[\[4\]](#cite_note-AP31july-5)
 to a remotely detonated explosive device previously hidden in his bedroom at the IRGC-run guesthouse.[\[2\]](#cite_note-:4-2)
 According to analysts, the assassination exposed critical security flaws.[\[9\]](#cite_note-nyt3aug-10)
[\[10\]](#cite_note-:9-11)
 The investigation has led to the arrest of over two dozen individuals, including senior intelligence and military officials, as well as staff from the guesthouse.[\[9\]](#cite_note-nyt3aug-10)

Haniyeh was a prominent figure within Hamas since the organization's founding in 1987. Haniyeh was the highest-ranking Hamas political leader killed since the start of the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")
.[\[11\]](#cite_note-wsj31july-12)

airstrikes](/wiki/2024_Homs_airstrikes "2024 Homs airstrikes")<br>    <br>*   [Iranian consulate in Damascus airstrike](/wiki/Israeli_airstrike_on_the_Iranian_consulate_in_Damascus "Israeli airstrike on the Iranian consulate in Damascus")<br>    <br>*   [2024 Iran–Israel conflict](/wiki/2024_Iran%E2%80%93Israel_conflict "2024 Iran–Israel conflict")<br>    *   [April 2024 Iranian strikes](/wiki/April_2024_Iranian_strikes_on_Israel "April 2024 Iranian strikes on Israel")<br>        <br>    *   [April 2024 Israeli strikes](/wiki/April_2024_Israeli_strikes_on_Iran "April 2024 Israeli strikes on Iran")<br>        <br>    *   [October 2024 Iranian strikes](/wiki/October_2024_Iranian_strikes_on_Israel "October 2024 Iranian strikes on Israel")<br>        <br>    *   [October 2024 Israeli strikes](/wiki/October_2024_Israeli_strikes_on_Iran "October 2024 Israeli strikes on Iran")<br>        <br>    *   [Iran–Israel war](/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Israel_war "Iran–Israel war")<br>        <br>    *   [Ceasefire](/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Israel_war_ceasefire "Iran–Israel war ceasefire")<br>        <br>*   Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh<br>*   [Masyaf strikes](/wiki/2024_Masyaf_strikes "2024 Masyaf strikes")<br>    <br>*   [2024 leak of U.S. In the photograph, he is accompanied by [Ziyad al-Nakhalah](/wiki/Ziyad_al-Nakhalah "Ziyad al-Nakhalah")
, leader of [Palestinian Islamic Jihad](/wiki/Palestinian_Islamic_Jihad "Palestinian Islamic Jihad")
, and a group of men posing with a model of the [Dome of the Rock](/wiki/Dome_of_the_Rock "Dome of the Rock")
.[\[17\]](#cite_note-nyt30jul-18)

### Killings of Hamas officials

In response to the [October 7 attack](/wiki/October_7_attack "October 7 attack")
, Israel stated it would target Hamas leaders.[\[11\]](#cite_note-wsj31july-12)
 On 2 January 2024, Hamas deputy [Saleh al-Arouri](/wiki/Saleh_al-Arouri "Saleh al-Arouri")
 was [assassinated](/wiki/Assassination_of_Saleh_al-Arouri "Assassination of Saleh al-Arouri")
 in an airstrike in [Beirut](/wiki/Beirut "Beirut")
.[\[18\]](#cite_note-j076-19)
 On 13 July 2024, Israel attempted to assassinate Hamas military chief [Mohammed Deif](/wiki/Mohammed_Deif "Mohammed Deif")
, with the [Israel Defense Forces](/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces "Israel Defense Forces")
 announcing his death on 1 August.[\[19\]](#cite_note-20)
 Hours before Haniyeh's death, Israel announced the [assassination of Fuad Shukr](/wiki/Killing_of_Fuad_Shukr "Killing of Fuad Shukr")
, a senior [Hezbollah](/wiki/Hezbollah "Hezbollah")
 leader in Beirut.[\[11\]](#cite_note-wsj31july-12)

Assassination
-------------

The initial report of Ismail Haniyeh's killing emerged from Iran's [Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps](/wiki/Islamic_Revolutionary_Guard_Corps "Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps")
 (IRGC), who provided limited specifics regarding the circumstances of his death, which it said occurred early on 31 July and indicated that the incident was under investigation. Ismail Haniyeh")
**

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/4a/Commons-logo.svg/20px-Commons-logo.svg.png)](/wiki/File:Commons-logo.svg)
 Media related to [Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Assassination_of_Ismail_Haniyeh "commons:Category:Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh")
 at Wikimedia Commons

[Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")

Part of the [Gaza–Israel conflict](/wiki/Gaza%E2%80%93Israel_conflict "Gaza–Israel conflict")
, the [Israeli–Palestinian conflict](/wiki/Israeli%E2%80%93Palestinian_conflict "Israeli–Palestinian conflict")
, and the [Middle Eastern crisis (2023–present)](/wiki/Middle_Eastern_crisis_(2023%E2%80%93present) "Middle Eastern crisis (2023–present)")

| Resolutions | *   [A/RES/ES-10/21](/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly_Resolution_ES-10/21 "United Nations General Assembly Resolution ES-10/21")<br>    <br>*   [S/RES/2712](/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council_Resolution_2712 "United Nations Security Council Resolution 2712")<br>    <br>*   [A/RES/ES-10/22](/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly_Resolution_ES-10/22 "United Nations General Assembly Resolution ES-10/22")<br>    <br>*   [S/RES/2720](/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council_Resolution_2720 "United Nations Security Council Resolution 2720")<br>    <br>*   [S/RES/2728](/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council_Resolution_2728 "United Nations Security Council Resolution 2728")<br>    <br>*   [A/RES/ES-10/23](/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly_Resolution_ES-10/23 "United Nations General Assembly Resolution ES-10/23")<br>    <br>*   [S/RES/2735](/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council_Resolution_2735 "United Nations Security Council Resolution 2735") |
| Inquiry | *   [Independent International Commission of Inquiry on the Occupied Palestinian Territory](/wiki/Independent_International_Commission_of_Inquiry_on_the_Occupied_Palestinian_Territory "Independent International Commission of Inquiry on the Occupied Palestinian Territory") |

| Global courts | *   [_South Africa v. He also called for the Palestinian people to unite.[\[20\]](#cite_note-arabiya-21)
[\[85\]](#cite_note-89)
 Palestine's deputy permanent observer to the United Nations, Feda Abdelhady Nasser, called on the international community to stop Israel from dragging the Middle East into the "abyss".[\[86\]](#cite_note-unsc-90)
 Former [PLO](/wiki/Palestine_Liberation_Organization "Palestine Liberation Organization")
 member [Hanan Ashrawi](/wiki/Hanan_Ashrawi "Hanan Ashrawi")
 said that Israel's "gangster style" assassination of Haniyeh was made to "inflame the whole region".[\[87\]](#cite_note-91)

Hamas said that it mourned the death of Haniyeh, who it said was killed in "a treacherous Zionist raid on his residence".[\[88\]](#cite_note-x734-92)
 Senior Hamas official [Mousa Abu Marzook](/wiki/Mousa_Abu_Marzook "Mousa Abu Marzook")
 said that Haniyeh's assassination was "a cowardly act that will not pass in vain".[\[89\]](#cite_note-c729-93)
 Another senior official, [Sami Abu Zuhri](/wiki/Sami_Abu_Zuhri "Sami Abu Zuhri")
, accused Israel of killing Haniyeh, stating that it aims to break the will of Hamas and the Palestinians.[\[90\]](#cite_note-aljazeera.com-94)
 Hamas's military wing, the Al-Qassam Brigades, called the assassination a "dangerous event" that will have "major repercussions across the entire region".[\[91\]](#cite_note-95)

Palestinian Islamic Jihad released a statement saying that it "mourns with the Palestinian people and the Arab and [Islamic nation](/wiki/Ummah "Ummah")
" for the death of Haniyeh.[\[92\]](#cite_note-:0-96)

On 2 August, former [Grand Mufti of Jerusalem](/wiki/Grand_Mufti_of_Jerusalem "Grand Mufti of Jerusalem")
 Sheikh [Ekrima Sa'id Sabri](/wiki/Ekrima_Sa%27id_Sabri "Ekrima Sa'id Sabri")
 was arrested by Israeli police on suspicion of inciting "terrorism" after calling Haniyeh a "martyr" during a sermon in [East Jerusalem](/wiki/East_Jerusalem "East Jerusalem")
.[\[93\]](#cite_note-97)

### Iran

Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei held an emergency Supreme National Security Council meeting with top Iranian officials following the assassination.[\[17\]](#cite_note-nyt30jul-18)
 Khamenei later stated that "With this action, the criminal and [terrorist](/wiki/Israel_and_state-sponsored_terrorism "Israel and state-sponsored terrorism")
 [Zionist regime](/wiki/Zionist_regime "Zionist regime")
 prepared the ground for harsh punishment for itself, and we consider it our duty to seek revenge for his blood as he was [martyred](/wiki/Shahid "Shahid")
 in the territory of the Islamic Republic of Iran".[\[94\]](#cite_note-c453-98)
 _The New York Times_, citing Iranian officials, reported that he ordered direct strikes against Israel in response to the assassination.[\[43\]](#cite_note-nyt31jul-44)
[\[95\]](#cite_note-99)
 [Foreign Ministry](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Iran) "Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Iran)")
 spokesman [Nasser Kanaani](/wiki/Nasser_Kanaani "Nasser Kanaani")
 condemned the assassination, stating that Haniyeh's "blood will never be wasted".[\[7\]](#cite_note-aje.io-8)
 President Masoud Pezeshkian condemned the assassination and said Iran will defend its territorial integrity and make those responsible regret their actions.[\[4\]](#cite_note-AP31july-5)
 The government announced three days of public mourning for Haniyeh.[\[96\]](#cite_note-100)
 At the [United Nations](/wiki/United_Nations "United Nations")
, Iran's ambassador [Amir Saeid Iravani](/wiki/Amir_Saeid_Iravani "Amir Saeid Iravani")
, called on the [UN Security Council](/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council "United Nations Security Council")
 to condemn Israel and said that Iran had a right to respond in self-defence to the killing, which he described as part of "Israel's decades-long pattern of terrorism and sabotage targeting Palestinians and other supporters of the Palestinian cause across the region and beyond." He also accused the United States of responsibility over the assassination.[\[86\]](#cite_note-unsc-90)
 The chief of staff of the [Iranian armed forces](/wiki/Islamic_Republic_of_Iran_Armed_Forces "Islamic Republic of Iran Armed Forces")
, [Mohammad Bagheri](/wiki/Mohammad_Bagheri_(general) "Mohammad Bagheri (general)")
, suggested that the response could come as part of a coordinated effort with the [Axis of Resistance](/wiki/Axis_of_Resistance "Axis of Resistance")
.[\[3\]](#cite_note-:7-3)

The [Tehran Stock Exchange](/wiki/Tehran_Stock_Exchange "Tehran Stock Exchange")
 fell 1.9%.[\[97\]](#cite_note-101)
 Iran's chief prosecutor warned journalists against "spreading rumours".[\[98\]](#cite_note-102)

A red flag was hoisted above the [Jamkaran Mosque](/wiki/Jamkaran_Mosque "Jamkaran Mosque")
 in [Qom](/wiki/Qom "Qom")
 and the [Milad Tower](/wiki/Milad_Tower "Milad Tower")
 in Tehran was lit up in red overnight.[\[3\]](#cite_note-:7-3)
 A large banner was placed in Tehran's Palestine Square, featuring a portrait of Haniyeh alongside the Dome of the Rock, with a message in [Farsi](/wiki/Persian_language "Persian language")
 and [Hebrew](/wiki/Hebrew_language "Hebrew language")
 reading: 'Wait for severe punishment.'"[\[99\]](#cite_note-103)

Opposition figures [Masih Alinejad](/wiki/Masih_Alinejad "Masih Alinejad")
, [Hamed Esmaeilion](/wiki/Hamed_Esmaeilion "Hamed Esmaeilion")
 and [Reza Pahlavi](/wiki/Reza_Pahlavi,_Crown_Prince_of_Iran "Reza Pahlavi, Crown Prince of Iran")
 called the killing of Haniyeh the sign of iniquity of the Iranian regime.[\[100\]](#cite_note-104)
[\[101\]](#cite_note-105)
[\[102\]](#cite_note-106)

### Israel

The Israel Defense Forces told [CNN](/wiki/CNN "CNN")
 they "don't respond to reports in the foreign media".[\[103\]](#cite_note-107)
 The IDF did not release new security guidelines for civilians.[\[6\]](#cite_note-reuters31july-7)
 Heritage Minister [Amihai Eliyahu](/wiki/Amihai_Eliyahu "Amihai Eliyahu")
 praised the assassination, saying that it "makes the world a little better",[\[104\]](#cite_note-108)
[\[90\]](#cite_note-aljazeera.com-94)
 and that killing him was "the right way to cleanse the world from this filth."[\[105\]](#cite_note-109)
[\[106\]](#cite_note-110)
 Israel increased security measures at its diplomatic missions and Jewish sites worldwide.[\[107\]](#cite_note-111)
 The security of [Israel's delegation](/wiki/Israel_at_the_2024_Summer_Olympics "Israel at the 2024 Summer Olympics")
 in the [2024 Summer Olympics](/wiki/2024_Summer_Olympics "2024 Summer Olympics")
 was increased due to fears of potential attacks.[\[108\]](#cite_note-112)
 Then-Defense Minister [Yoav Gallant](/wiki/Yoav_Gallant "Yoav Gallant")
 addressed troops at an [Arrow](/wiki/Arrow_(missile_family) "Arrow (missile family)")
 missile air-defense battery, stating, "We don't want war, but we are preparing for all possibilities."[\[109\]](#cite_note-113)
 In December 2024, Defense Minister [Israel Katz](/wiki/Israel_Katz "Israel Katz")
 confirmed Israel's responsibility in the assassination of Haniyeh while delivering a threat to the Yemeni [Houthi movement](/wiki/Houthi_movement "Houthi movement")
, stating, "We will strike \[the Houthis'\] strategic infrastructure and decapitate its leaders. Just as we did to Haniyeh, [Sinwar](/wiki/Killing_of_Yahya_Sinwar "Killing of Yahya Sinwar")
, and [Nasrallah](/wiki/2024_Hezbollah_headquarters_strike "2024 Hezbollah headquarters strike")
, in Tehran, Gaza, and Lebanon—we will do in [Hodeidah](/wiki/Al_Hudaydah "Al Hudaydah")
 and [Sanaa](/wiki/Sanaa "Sanaa")
."[\[5\]](#cite_note-:8-6)
[\[110\]](#cite_note-114)

### International

The United Nations Security Council held an emergency session on 31 July following the assassination, during which China, Russia and Algeria condemned the killing. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20240731123456/https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/31/middleeast/analysis-iran-options-ismail-haniyeh-killing-intl/index.html)
     from the original on 31 July 2024. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20240731041436/https://www.wsj.com/world/middle-east/hamas-political-leader-ismail-haniyeh-killed-in-iran-5723ad8b?mod=hp_lead_pos1)
     from the original on 31 July 2024. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20240731034454/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/31/hamass-political-chief-ismail-haniyeh-assassinated-in-iran-state-media)
     from the original on 31 July 2024. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20240731040020/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2024/07/31/israel-hamas-war-latest-news-leader-ismail-haniyeh-killed/)
     from the original on 31 July 2024."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article discusses the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh on July 31, 2024, in Tehran, Iran. The attack was carried out by Israel. The article does not mention any information about WhatsApp tracking.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.
